title: Service Desk Manager
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Our client has a contract opportunity available for an experienced Help Desk/Service Desk Manager. Candidate should have 2 to 5 years managing an internal or offsite help desk engagement. Overview:  The service desk managers role is to oversee IT service desk personnel and ensure that end users are receiving the appropriate technical assistance.This includes the responsibility of managing the procedures related to prioritization and resolution of incidents, including the monitoring, tracking, and coordination of help desk functions.The service desk manager is also responsible for ensuring high levels of customer service quality and availability.The service desk managers role is a hands-on position that will require technical abilities to understand the service desk application, conduct analytics, and develop some solutions using programming. title: Business Analyst
description: \r\n                            job summary:    Looking for a  business analyst for a year long contract in southern NJ Background: - Business System Analysis - Financial services would be a plus Manager looks for 3 things: - Communication - Culture fit (Looking for someone who is an extravert and can be easily understood) - Aptitude to learn    location: Mount Laurel, New Jersey  job type: Contract  salary: $40 - 65  per hour  work hours: 9 to 5  education: No Degree Required     responsibilities:  SUMMARY: Required to understand new business requirements, conduct business analysis Must have knowledge of products and systems process in order to define and document business systems requirements for business unit. title: Network Engineer
description: \r\n                            job summary:  In this role, youll help build the technology responsible for our core services. Your work will influence the success of companies across the world. Members of our Technology team are experts in the field, working to evaluate and improve todays systems while building tomorrows. The Network Engineer is responsible for design and development of network services and technologies to meet client and business unit requirements. The primary objective is to identify optimal networking and communications solutions that deliver long term capabilities, capacity, reliability and resiliency for the business units and clients to successfully maintain and grow their business operations.    location: Parsippany, New Jersey  job type: Contract  salary: $62 - 65  per hour  work hours: 8 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  This role involves understanding of the client and business unit requirements, and designing and deploying optimal networking and connectivity solutions that enable clients and business units to achieve their operational and business goals.Making technology decisions as they relate to the overall network architecture and associated technologies. This includes (but is not limited to) IP addressing; possibly creating schemes to resolve IP addressing conflicts; route conflicts, switching, routing protocols, load-balancing and route selection technologies that may include VRF and policy-based routing, policy-based load-balancing, etc.Day-to-day interaction with telecom providers, equipment suppliers and 3rd party network vendors, to engage their technical resources to perform tasks.Role sometimes requires scheduling and attendance on overnight maintenance windows. Resource can expect to routinely be called upon to analyze and interpret traffic and utilization of services on network connections.Participation in disaster recovery exercises, pre-production certification testing and troubleshooting events is expected.Coordinate internal operations to meet and exceed data communications project expectations including but not limited to engineering/development, certifications testing, Network and IT Operations, capacity planning and production readiness.Accountable for resolving all project level, cross-functional, partnership issues and escalations. Manage partner/client expectations for data communications connectivity and related services to products and applications, throughout project(s) lifecycle.Client expectations include functionality, cost, delivery schedule, support readiness and relationships (usually working directly with senior level technical resources, project managers and business decision makers at client).Performs other duties as required.   qualifications:  College degree or comparable certification in IT (CCNA/CCNP), telecommunications, computer science, or related field is preferred.   skills:  Hands on experience in layer-3 protocols (EIGRP,BGP, etc), route distribution, route filtering, etc.. Hands on experience configuring and upgrading Cisco IOS. (ACLs, SNMP, IPSEC, VPN, Router Security).Hands on experience using MS Visio network design software.Hands on experience with QOS, NAT/PAT, MPLS, Frame Relay, ATM, VPN, VoIP.Minimum of 3 years of experience required in design, planning, coordination and implementation of technology projects among multiple telecom and equipment vendors and customers. description: \r\n                            job summary:  Provide Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) (IT Governance Control) management, security, compliance and risk management oversight for all Pearson core financial systems. Oversee and own access control for all core Financial Systems from a business perspective Ensure audit and accounting of access to meet SOX and EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements Ensure the ERP deployment meets business objectives and regulatory requirements including technical and service management controls for SOX compliance in all jurisdictions, languages and legal frameworks in which Pearson operate  Deliverables. For each Financial System delivered to Business As Usual (BAU) as part of The Enabling Programme (TEP) Roll-out - Work with the business owners to identify the required Roles and Responsibilities used to govern access to Financial Systems Provide and maintain Governance processes for Access Control and Auditing for all core Financial systems in line with IT Governance Controls (ITGC) requirements Ensure quarterly re-certification of user access across systems and annual reconciliation of all Access Control changes to Financial Systems Work with the TEP project team to Identify and document security requirements including all new Roles and Responsibilities, ensuring these are put in requirements management system for future TEP releases Work with the Business to remediate as many risks as possible related to access control and segregation of duty (SoD); implementing compensating controls where required and document those that cannot be remediated, raising security exception requests where required Work with CISO to document any risks outside the scope of Finance and manage their remediation and any dependencies Ensure the technical and procedural controls are in place to support legal and regulatory compliance of the TEP technical solution once it moves to BAU Ensure Pearson policy and Standards compliance of the technical solution and supporting processes Act as the single point of contact (SPoC) for the business on all matters related to changes in Access Control processes for Finance. Provide independent oversight of technical changes to access on the Financial Systems, including privileged access, supplier access and SI access, ensuring there are no unauthorised changes Work with internal audit to make sure audit findings around security controls are resolved Work with internal compliance to understand their requirements and ensure required controls are implemented Work with privacy team to ensure any data protection and privacy controls are included in the security requirements and controls where applicable Implement and maintain ITIL Service Management processes for: Access Control, Segregation of Duty and Accounting on Financial Systems Analyse business impact and exposure, based on emerging security threats, changes in Regulations and document the deltas Communicate risks and solutions to management, business partners and IT staff (e.g. Database Admins -DBAs) Create a weekly report of the current risk and issue status Embrace a culture of continuous service improvement and service excellence. Stay up to date on Oracle security trends within the finance industry; legal & regulatory requirements in all jurisdictions in which Pearson operates, especially related to financial controls. title: Technical Business Analyst / Project Manager
description: \r\n                            job summary:  The Technical Business Analyst (TBA) evaluates Information Technology support needs for business operations according to policies, procedures, protocol and standards. The TBA is responsible for analysis and assessment of business processes, identification of system requirements, and functional definition of planned / unplanned system changes or portfolio requests. He/she is responsible for identifying Information technology solutions that support more efficient and effective work performance based on inherent knowledge of business functions and processes and available technologies. Project Management is also within the purview of the TBA, developing project schedules, identifying milestones, and reporting progress to stake holders when required. Key production systems such as regional Intranet content publishing, database management and administration are also supported by the TBA.    location: Morristown, New Jersey  job type: Permanent  salary: $75,000 - 90,000  per year  work hours: 8 to 5  education: No Degree Required     responsibilities:  Portfolio Management:   Partner with the business process owners to ensure that regional business needs and goals are met by providing accurate documented portfolio requests and monitoring the submitted requests through the Portfolio Management Cycle.Analyze and document Key-User requirements and proposed improved business processes.Work with Business Process Owners to identify priorities, business impact, and associated risks.Support the regional business departments in evaluating any proposed changes to their workflow processes resulting from the Change Management system.Research and develop new business ideas using the Project Management Office (PMO) structure and automation whenever possible.  Technical:   Provide regional system and international support to local and international project teams.  In a Project Manager role, establish project schedules (identify tasks, duration and dependencies, timelines, resources, costs) for regional projects. International projects may require regional project management as well.  Provide hands-on backup support to the current core business applications (when required) .  Resolve assigned incident/service request tickets within SLA framework as part of the Service Cycle, closing incident tickets for regional business systems.  Publish First Page of regional intranet and provide 2nd level support for FirstSpirit content management regionally. description: \r\n                            job summary:  We are in need of a strong Network Security Engineer in Berkeley Heights, NJ. The Network Security Engineer should be able to start ASAP. The Network Security Engineer must have Firewall skills (Checkpoint, Palo Alto, Cisco Proxys, Ironcore, Scansafe) , RSA Authentication, Policy Management, F5 ecperience, etc. The person should be personable and able to work well with coworkers and upper management, must have a strong securities background  and ability to move from task to task with ease.    location: Berkeley Heights, New Jersey  job type: Contract  salary: $60 - 73  per hour  work hours: 8 to 4  education: High School     responsibilities:  Managing CheckPoint firewalls[ IPSO/GAIA] rules and logs. Managing Cisco ASA Firewalls and Cisco AnyConnect VPN clients. Configuring and managing Cisco CWS portals. Day to day administration of RSA Authentication Manager 8.x with RSA soft and hard tokens. Supporting new application deployments through F5 LTM +APM and troubleshooting any issues with application owners. Participate in weekly change control meeting and execute weekly firewall, proxy and network related changes.    qualifications:  Technologies: Windows Server 2008, 2012, Windows 7, Windows 10, Active Directory, AD GPO, DNS, IIS, CheckPoint Firewall R77.x, Nokia IPSO, GAIA, Palo Alto Firewalls, F5 - LTM, APM, RSA Authentication Manager 8.x, Cisco ASA, Cisco IronPort WSA, Cisco CWS [SCANSAFE], Bluecoat Proxies, Bluecoat Director, Infoblox DNS/DHCP/IPAM, IPSEC VPN, Cisco AnyConnect VPN. title: Pega  Marketing
description: \r\n                            job summary:    We are very excited to share this opportunity with a leading telecommunications company. Based on your experience i figured I would send over the information to you and see if this would spark any interest.  Please let me know if you would like to get considered for this role. The Pega Business Decisioning Architect will collaborate with marketing and technology application teams to understand the business requirement, the business processes, and convert the business processes to Pega system flows. In this role, you will create the complete decisioning logic on the basis of which our marketing strategy will rely upon across channels and customer life cycle stages. You will be responsible for creating a decisioning architecture which integrates seamlessly with complex technology landscape consisting of multiple technology stacks.   Responsible for design of the core decisioning logic for real time marketing decisioning platform based on business requirements.  Assess decisioning platform capabilities, and create a roadmap for expansion to enable seamless omni-channel experience and personalized in-context customer interactions.  Lead and own the implementation of decisioning enhancement roadmap applying appropriate industry standards.  Design and configure rules and flows and assist with the draft user interface and draft process flow development.  Communicate technical concepts, problems and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences.  Keep accurate record of materials used, expected deliverables, and milestones achieved.  Identify and mitigate existing business risk or risks associated with solution architecture.  Youll need to have:   Bachelors degree or four or more years of work experience.  Six or more years of relevant work experience.  Five or more years of Pega end to end implementation experience.  Five or more years of Pega Projects as a Business Architect.  Experience with technical troubleshooting and problem solving.  5+ to 7 years experience  Seniority Level - Mid-Senior   Minimum Education - Bachelors Degree   These are a plus:   A Bachelors degree  Pega PRPC version 7 platform experience.  Excellent interpersonal, business communication and writing skills.  A customer experience focus and are detail oriented.  A good understanding of integration with an enterprise multi-tier application.  Ability to work independently.  Experience working in a fast-paced, often changing, and dynamic environment.     We look forward to working with you and learning more about your goals,wants, and needs. Best regards, -- Matias Rodriguez  Technical Recruiter Randstad Technologies Office phone: 973-658-5749 Mobile phone: 908-619-9353 Matias.Rodriguez@randstadusa.com  www.randstadusa.com     location: Basking Ridge, New Jersey  job type: Permanent  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  Responsible for design of the core decisioning logic for real time marketing decisioning platform based on business requirements.Assess decisioning platform capabilities, and create a roadmap for expansion to enable seamless omni-channel experience and personalized in-context customer interactions.Lead and own the implementation of decisioning enhancement roadmap applying appropriate industry standards.Design and configure rules and flows and assist with the draft user interface and draft process flow development.Communicate technical concepts, problems and solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences.Keep accurate record of materials used, expected deliverables, and milestones achieved.Identify and mitigate existing business risk or risks associated with solution architecture.   qualifications:  Youll need to have:  Bachelors degree or four or more years of work experience.Six or more years of relevant work experience.Five or more years of Pega end to end implementation experience.Five or more years of Pega Projects as a Business Architect.Experience with technical troubleshooting and problem solving.    Even better if you have:  Pega PRPC version 7 platform experience.Excellent interpersonal, business communication and writing skills.A customer experience focus and are detail oriented.A good understanding of integration with an enterprise multi-tier application.Ability to work independently.Experience working in a fast-paced, often changing, and dynamic environment.   skills:  The Pega Business Decisioning Architect will collaborate with marketing and technology application teams to understand the business requirement, the business processes, and convert the business processes to Pega system flows. In this role, you will create the complete decisioning logic on the basis of which our marketing strategy will rely upon across channels and customer life cycle stages. We are engaged from pre-project kickoff through successful implementation into production. Solution architecture may include understanding thekey business process flows, and developing corresponding system process flows down to physical transaction/data flows for a solution.Support sales initiatives by driving overall technical architecture design discussion within the Enterprise Solution Delivery framework.Act as consultant as well as provide support during the implementation; such as answering architecture relatedquestions, helping to mitigate risk, resolve issues, review/approve/update with regard to key design changes foraugmentation or enhancement of the Solution Architecture.   qualifications:  Ability to effectively work within a team environment.Software Development leadership experience in batch processing in Financial Services Industry experience description: \r\n                            job summary:  Title Sr Product Designer UI/UX Description Enterprise company product design team has a passion for creating intuitive and engaging digital experiences that people want to use again and again and were looking for a talented new team member. As a Product Designer, you know how a product needs to look, feel, and work, with an understanding of what users want and need in the digital space as well as in real life. You will be involved in all aspects of the product life cycle, from brainstorming the next great innovation to tweaking pixels the night before launch. You will be expected to use your repertoire of product design, interaction design, and visual design skills to produce elegantly simple products. Responsibilities - Take broad concepts and create something useful, usable, and enjoyable for our millions of users - Design flows and experiences that are incredibly simple and enjoyable - Create prototypes, proof of concept documents, wire frames, and user interfaces - Contribute to high-level strategic decisions with the rest of the product teams - Lead other designers in order to continually raise their bar for quality - Partner with planners, strategists, and researchers to help conduct interviews, competitive research, and strategic analysis that support your work - Be a champion for the good work the team does and ensure we deliver on the promise of the vision we develop - Present work in a clear and easy to understand manner to a wide range of audiences (business, technology, executives) - Collaborate with and sometimes lead/direct other designers Qualifications - A portfolio showcasing your strong product and design skills - Successful experience designing, building, and shipping high quality mobile apps or digital experiences - title: Cloud Engineer
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Responsibilities We are seeking a transformational Cloud engineer.  As a member of the team you will participate with groups that are responsible for the overall strategy, architecture and design of the Platform. We are seeking a motivated individual with a drive to be on the cutting edge while helping change the culture of IT towards a more nimble and agile methodology leveraging next generation cloud technology platforms. You will have breadth across technology stacks while leveraging a deep hands skillset evaluating and recommending solutions in partnership with engineering and development teams throughout the organization. You will be asked to provide guidance across network, storage, management, and virtualization teams. Technology focus will involve both on premise and external cloud environments. Additional emphasis will be on container strategies and ecosystems such as Docker and Kubernetes supporting the clients rapidly increasing data and compute requirements.  Technology governance and control are foundational elements to this strategy and this position will play a key role in laying that foundation.    Collaborate cross functionally to develop our target state cloud architecture and supporting organization model along with the platform roadmap required to achieve that target state.  Define multiyear platform strategy adjusting to new technologies and requirements as they evolve.  Drive cloud/ technology discussions and facilitate decision with other teams within the organization.  Executes POCs and feasibility studies to validate next-gen product concepts and technologies leveraging results to guide business and technology decisions.  Enforce adherence to architectural standards/principles, global product-specific guidelines, usability design standards, governance, cost controls, etc.  Drive technical designs to consensus and approval.  Work with product owners and other functional teams to translate the roadmap into releases.  Keep abreast of and gain expertise in the evolving technology and understand how new technologies could be applied to our Cloud offering.  Stay current with IAAS & PAAS trends and incorporate emerging technology to benefit the platform.  Research, test and understand the value of a containerized cloud    Qualifications/Requirements  4-5 years of experience in all aspects of cloud computing (infrastructure, storage, platforms and data) with a proven track-record implementing in large scale environments. Experience in cloud computing based services architecture, technical design and implementations including IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS delivery models. Hands on experience with AWS and Microsoft Azure 2-3 years of experience with VMware VRealize suite including blueprints, orchestrator and Business Suite. Ability to work and communicate effectively and influence stakeholders on internal engineering teams, software development teams and strategic vendors. 3-4 years experience with Cisco UCS fabric management and VMWare 6.xAbility to create top notch business cases for new technology proposalsThorough understanding of infrastructure automation, continuous integration/deployment, networking, storage and cloud-based delivery models. Deep expertise in cloud architecture and transformation strategy as well as product architecture. Knowledge of infrastructure design & server infrastructure implementation. Experience with networking and web standards such as DNS, DHCP, TCP/IP, HTTP, web security mechanisms, proxies, firewalls & application delivery controllers. Hands on experience with AWS and Microsoft Azure Balance of strategic and tactical skills and the ability to work on cross-functional teams. Ability to write technical documentation (platform architecture, strategy, engineering etc.) Scripting and / or programming experience of configuration management tools such as Puppet & AnsibleAbility to work on multiple concurrent complex projects and to coordinate the work of others in the cloud environment. Experience with build tools, CI/CD, Devops and agile principles Experience building and supporting mission critical infrastructure for critical applications, running in a highly distributed manner. Possess an understanding of system testing including platform, integration, load and scale testing. Proficient at multitasking and proactive in work responsibilities    Desired Characteristics  B.S. degree in Information Technology, Business Administration or other technical disciplineProject Management Experience     location: Englewood, New Jersey  job type: Permanent  salary: $130,000 - 150,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  We are seeking a transformational Cloud engineer. title: Scrum Master
description: \r\n                            job summary:  This is an exciting position, where you will be joining an organization that is new to Agile.  You will have the opportunity to help guide and coach the Scrum Team, and the organization on how to use Agile/Scrum practices & values.  In this highly visible position, you will be working with top executives of the firm, on assisting in the transformation of the company on how they approach projects. This is a growth opportunity, where you will be influential to the growth of the organization.  You will be working with Product Owners, Development Teams, and executives, where you will building relationships, and helping to foster new ideas in a collaborative environment. Description: The Scrum Masters job is to deliver maximum value to the customer. Scrum Masters facilitate daily stand-ups and supporting the team in following the Scrum delivery process. Scrum Master also handle traditional project management duties including: scope definition, staffing, communication of status to clients and partners, budget oversight and risk/issue management.    location: Madison, New Jersey  job type: Contract  salary: $50 - 60  per hour  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  Essential Duties: - Strongly serving and supporting the Product Owner and Development Team - Providing all support to the team using a servant leadership style and leading by example. This person should personify Scrum and Agile. - Guiding and Coaching the Scrum Team and organization on how to use Agile/Scrum practices & values - Guiding and Coaching both the Scrum Team and the Development team on how to get the most out of self-organization - Guiding and Coaching both the Scrum Team and the Development team on self-organizing to fill in the intentional gaps left in the Agile/Scrum frameworks - Assessing the Scrum Maturity of the team and organization and coaching the team to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization - Ensure product quality expectations are defined and known across the team. -Track progress and help the team achieve their commitments. - Removing impediments or guiding the team to remove impediments by finding the right personnel to remove the impediment. -Progress is monitored daily when problems are identified work with team to develop corrective actions. ---Manage and report the status of scope, schedule, resourcing and financials. - Building a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis of healing and problem solving. - Facilitating getting the work done without coercion, assigning, or dictating the work. - Facilitating discussion, decision making, and conflict resolution and all scrum ceremonies - Assisting with internal and external communication, improving transparency, and radiating information - Supporting and educating the Product Owner, especially with respect to refining(aka grooming) and managing the product backlog. -Collaborate with the team in scheduling work, including defect remediation and refactoring, guarding against the accumulation of technical debt. -Work with technical team and product owner balancing the interests of both when issues arise. -Guide project team meetings including sprint pre/planning meetings, daily scrum and sprint review meetings. Facilitate retrospective discussions and support continuous improvement efforts. -Limit the external interference the team must deal with.    qualifications:  - Degree - information technology or business or related field. - Must have First level Scrum Master certification (CSM ) (PSM), PMI-ACP    skills:  - Experience playing the Scrum Master role for at least three years for a Scrum team. - Excellent skills and knowledge of servant leadership, facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, continual improvement, empowerment, and increasing transparency -Exceptional people skills. Comfortable working with a diverse group of people and serve as arbitrator when conflicts arise. - Knowledge of numerous well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach(example: numerous Burndown techniques, numerous Retrospective formats, handling bugs, etc) - The ability to distinguish between what "is Scrum" what is "not Scrum" - Knowledge of other approaches discussed in the Agile space: XP, Kanban, Nexus, LeSS, SAFe, Crystal, FDD, etc - Knowledge and/or experience with widely successful Agile techniques: User Stories, ATDD, TDD, Continuous Integration, - Excellent communication and mentoring skills - Solid understanding of and demonstrated experience in using appropriate tools: - Agile Project Management tools such as Jira, Rally, or equivalent - Microsoft Project, Visio, and all Office Tools - Understanding of financial controls needed in project management and consulting work - In depth understanding of how to scope and estimate work. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Preferred Skills/Experience (Any of these is a plus) - Second or Third level Scrum Master certification (PSM II, PSM III, CSP, CTC) - PMI-PMP, and CSPO or equivalent preferred - Experience being on multiple Scrum teams in a variety of different contexts (different team sizes, different organizations, different cultures, co-located vs. distributed, etc) - Track record of continued and recent education in Scrum, including training, conferences, user groups, self study, etc. Continuous Testing, Pairing, Automated Testing, Agile Games - Applicable knowledge of the technologies used by the team - Experience applying a wide variety of well documented patterns and techniques for filling in the intentional gaps left in the Scrum approach(example: numerous Burndown techniques, numerous Retrospective formats, handling bugs,etc)     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Executive Recruiter
description: \nExecutive Recruiter What more could you do? Randstad Professionals, a nationwide leader in finance, accounting, HR, legal, marketing, and sales staffing is looking for aggressive, sales focused professionals. The fast paced and competitive world of staffing will give you the opportunity to experience the rich rewards that follow hard work.    The EmployerAt Randstad Professionals, people are our business - therefore, we strive to create the best balance between achieving business goals while recognizing the career goals and needs of our employees. While we set high expectations for every associate, each one is also given the autonomy and flexibility to build relationships with clients and candidates to grow their business their way. In other words, we know that success comes in many shapes and sizes - and we celebrate differences among our people.  Executive Recruiter Job Duties As an Executive Recruiter, you will become a career match-maker by connecting skilled professionals to organizations in need of skilled talent. Each day you will prospect and sell to new clients and problem solve with existing clients to fully understand their hiring needs. You will find, interview and evaluate talent to place in your clients current and future jobs resulting in full service talent delivery that keeps your clients business running at peak performance. The Ideal Candidate If you are an experienced sales and recruiting professional willing and able to execute aggressive business development initiatives, maintain efficient recruiting operations and execute effective candidate sourcing strategies, you have what it takes to be a successful Executive Recruiter for Randstad Professionals. We help you reach your greatest potential by providing best in class training programs throughout your career.   Job Requirements - Bachelors Degree or 4 years of equivalent work experience in the staffing industry- Minimum of 1 year staffing or recruiting experience- Minimum of 2 year of business to business sales experience Salary Range & Benefits - Unlimited commission potential- 401k + company match Application ProcessA Randstad Corporate Recruiter will review your application and contact qualified candidates for a phone interview. We will even give you the opportunity to bring your resume to life with a recorded video interview to share with everyone involved in the hiring process. Our best candidates will interview face to face with the Managing Director in their market. Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do" at Randstad Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Bilingual Admin. Assistant
description: \r\n                            Community Relations Associate needed in Long Island City, NY 11101Permanent OpportunityPay: $14.90 - $18.57/hourHours: Must be flexible to work between 8 AM-8 PM Mon-Fri and 9 AM-5 PM on weekends If you have a great sense of humor, enjoy working with people, want to work in a fast-paced and collaborative workplace, and if the thought of helping continue to build this incredible ride-sharing movement in NY (and across the U.S.) sounds exciting, we would love to meet you!Job Description: - Seeking motivated and organized Associates to join our growing team. In this role, you will help drive our local operations, including driver onboarding and providing customer support. - You will be the "face of the company" to new and existing drivers who are looking to participate in vehicle access programs - short-term rentals that become discounted to the driver if they complete a certain number of rides.Responsibilities:-Guide drivers through the rental onboarding process-Work closely with peers and third parties to organize onboarding events for Drivers-Educate Drivers one on one and in groups-Support Drivers with your knowledge of both NYC and the platformWorking hours: 8:00 AM - 8:00 AMSkills:-White glove customer service experience-High energy with an outgoing, social personality-you love talking to people! -Excellent & clear communication skills (verbal and written)-Excellent attention to detail...basically youre someone who enjoys and is good coloring inside the lines-Ability to multi-task and switch into different modes during the workday/week-Patient and thorough-Self-starter!Qualifications:-Bachelor???s degree preferred but not required-Spanish proficiency preferred-Retail, customer service, or vehicle rental experience-Excellent computer skills, proficient with Google SuiteManagement is looking for:-Connection with the broader driver and local community-Bachelor???s degree preferred, but not mandatory-2+ years of retail/CS experience dealing with complaints, unhappy customers, irate service, etc.-Empathetic, patient, service-oriented personality with an ability to absorb and diffuse tension-Infectious passion and enthusiasm (someone whos "hard to be mad at")-Problem solving ability that starts with deep company knowledge & communicating it to a driver and ends with suggestions on improving the product. title: Project Manager I
description: \r\n                            job summary:  - We really need candidates that have experience with market research. Ideally, theyve worked at places like Nielsen, Ipsos, TNS, comScore, Forrester, etc. Without that experience, client-side research experience in advertising would be next best. Description: Position Overview:   The Research Project Manager will manage project execution of research studies, coordinate global research projects and support senior staff as needed.   Executing day to day project related tasks, including scheduling, tracking results, etc.   Additional components of the job would include:   Review all of the claims, data sources, and methodologies that the B2B marketing organization publishes externally to ensure Google is only publishing high-quality work, accurately positioning the claims, and is in compliance with policies.   Initial syntheses of research outputs like results decks / reports and longer-form write-ups         location: New York, New York  job type: Contract  salary: $46.66 - 51.53 per hour  work hours: 9 to 6  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  1. Research Project management: Manage YouTube and Google brand health tracking research projects, including day-to-day management of local studies and coordination for global study. Work with research agency on day-to-day management of projects, develop questionnaire and sample design, oversee fieldwork and ensure that reporting is accurate and compelling. Incorporate findings into output materials, including decks and synthesis documents. 2. Claims approvals: Review and approve/deny all Google B2B marketing claims that will be published externally (Think with Google, keynote speeches, social posts, etc.) Manage twice-a-week office hours where marketers can join for methodology questions and respective claims approvals Manage all final claims approvals for Google marketing and sales executive leadership public presentations Create and manage a database of all approved claims to ensure consistent usage of the work moving forward 3. Output docs: Revise initial research output decks from vendor(s) and revise language to move closer to an executive-ready end-product Draft initial versions of qual research write-ups, identifying research themes and most critical takeaways for Google marketers    qualifications:   BA degree in Project Management.  Research and/or related discipline 5+ years of experience.    skills:  Required Skills/Qualifications:  BA degree in Project Management, Research and/or related discipline 5+ years of experience Managing multiple research projects, either as part of a research agency or as part of an internal client research team, with experience showing significant breadth and depth into qualitative and quantitative research methodologies (to review research that meets claims criteria) Demonstrate unrelenting attention to detail Excellent working knowledge of statistics and survey design, including margin of error calculations, correlational analysis, etc. and when to apply them Have demonstrated skills in project management, stakeholder management and process flow Have a customer service mindset for responding to requests quickly and documenting progress and an ability to identify opportunities to improve or streamline processes Able to operate in a very fast-paced environment with a deep desire to apply research findings to business strategies     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Java Developer (Equities)
description: \r\n                            job summary:  The trading technology team currently supports the global equity order generation and equity trading business using a series of in-house and vendor applications in an enterprise capacity. The hiring team is looking for a candidate who will build out equity trading applications using modern and innovative technology, while highlighting their quantitative and analytical skills. Tools developed by this group will be used to support the business teams responsible for order generation, decision support, and trading of orders related to quantitative strategies.  This role will challenge the ideal candidate to develop solutions that will enhance current processes, and scale to meet evolving business needs. The ideal candidate should have at least 7 years experience working with financial services firm in a developer capacity.  Essential skills should include exposure to front office applications, including Buy-side Order Management / Execution Management Systems, a knowledge of the equity trading workflows, as well as experience performing TCA analysis and calculations.We require self-motivated candidates, with excellent problem solving skills who can quickly adapt to working in a fast-paced business environment.  The preferred candidate will also have a history of providing value-add technology solutions to business problems.    location: New York, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $150,000 - 170,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  Responsibilities Design, develop, test, deploy, support high quality front office trading applications to be used by traders and quantitative teams Apply best practices using common design patterns and data structures, using innovative approaches to solve real-world business problems Be part of an empowered team following agile methodologies    qualifications:  Essential qualifications and skills Proven track record of developing front office applications for buy side firms Firm understanding of Java 1.6 - 1.8 core APIs, including collections, multi-threading, concurrency, XML, Spring (MVC, REST) and SWING Knowledge in a quantitative programming language (Python, NumPy/SciPy/Panda preferred ) Knowledge of data persistence in both RDMS and unstructured data paradigms Self-motivated candidate who can work just as easily as an individual as a team member Beneficial Entire web development process (design, development and deployment) across the UI stack covering HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript frameworks like AngularJS/ReactJS Exposure to calculating, interpreting, and utilizing Transaction Cost Analysis metrics Ability and willingness to learn new technologies Personal    skills:  Excellent interpersonal skills;  were looking for someone who can work closely with technology teammates and business sponsors, while still being able to challenge traditional thought processes with new and innovative ideas Track record of being able to communicate complex problems across teams and users in an understandable fashion     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Payroll Specialist
description: \r\n                            job summary:   Payroll Administrator     A large independent producer is seeking Payroll Administrator  RESPONSIBILIITES :     The Payroll Administrator is responsible for processing weekly, biweekly and semi-monthly payroll process, troubleshooting with external payroll and flexible benefits providers, ensuring compliance with applicable payroll tax laws, and addressing all related accounting issues.     Responsibilities Include but not limited to:  Process and "own" the payroll function.Execute the administration of payroll-related procedures for all employees (executive, exempt, and non-exempt, Union), including the processing, recording, and reporting of all compensation-related actions.Perform various technical payroll reporting and compliance activities across multiple entities.Complete year-end payroll activity.  Work closely with the HR and Accounting teams.Ensure accuracy of computations, statutory withholdings, Union rules, voluntary deductions, and overall employee payroll accuracy.Monitor the timeliness and accuracy of data submitted for payroll processing, such as timecards and adjustments.Help manage process with field production staff.Act as a liaison to external payroll service providers (ADP, Entertainment Partners) and other 3 rd  Party vendors to troubleshoot and resolve pending issues.Develop and design ad hoc reports utilizing ADP software.Analyze and reconcile any payroll out of balance situations.  Desired Skills and Experience     Requirements:  Minimum 2 years of related payroll experience in a Multi-State corporate environment.Strong Technical reporting skills.Strong people skills.Ability to quickly learn new Payroll systems software.Union payroll experience a plus Experience with ADP a plus. Strong Excel experience needed.       location: New York, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $50,000 - 60,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 6  education: Unknown  experience: 0 Years     responsibilities:  RESPONSIBILIITES : The Payroll Administrator is responsible for processing weekly, biweekly and semi-monthly payroll process, troubleshooting with external payroll and flexible benefits providers, ensuring compliance with applicable payroll tax laws, and addressing all related accounting issues. Responsibilities Include but not limited to:  Process and "own" the payroll function.Execute the administration of payroll-related procedures for all employees (executive, exempt, and non-exempt, Union), including the processing, recording, and reporting of all compensation-related actions.Perform various technical payroll reporting and compliance activities across multiple entities.Complete year-end payroll activity.  Work closely with the HR and Accounting teams.Ensure accuracy of computations, statutory withholdings, Union rules, voluntary deductions, and overall employee payroll accuracy.Monitor the timeliness and accuracy of data submitted for payroll processing, such as timecards and adjustments.Help manage process with field production staff.Act as a liaison to external payroll service providers (ADP, Entertainment Partners) and other 3 rd  Party vendors to troubleshoot and resolve pending issues.Develop and design ad hoc reports utilizing ADP software.Analyze and reconcile any payroll out of balance situations.   qualifications: Desired Skills and Experience Requirements:  Minimum 1 year of related payroll experience in a Multi-State corporate environment.Strong Technical reporting skills.Strong people skills.Ability to quickly learn new Payroll systems software.Union payroll experience a plus Experience with ADP a plus. Strong Excel experience needed.    skills: Payroll, Excel, ADP    Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Payroll Manager
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Are you looking for your next Payroll Management Position?  Do you have 5-10 years of Payroll Management experience as well as your CPP or APA certifications? Payroll Manager New York Position Summary Reporting to the Head of North America Payroll, the Manager, Payroll (US) is responsible for leading and managing a US payroll operations team dedicated to specific companies, which include union and non-union employees, directors fees, and retirees, and benefits.  The Manager will ensure compliance with Federal and State legislation as well as Fair Labor Standards Act that applies to payroll and ensuring compliance with company policies and SOC1 requirements. Partnering with the respective companies HR teams, the incumbent oversees the audit and processing of new hires, terminations, status changes, allocation changes, pay rate increases, retro and bonus pay, and manual checks, prepares import templates for salary increases and retro and bonus payments, oversees and approves payroll journal entries and general ledgers and oversees and approves payroll, benefits and union dues funding. The Manager, Payroll (US) is also responsible for working with the HRIS team for Workday HRIS payroll and benefits tables and codes administration and to create Workday HRIS environment change requests and validate test results when received before they are put into production. Responsibilities  Manage Payroll Operations team for US; responsible for coordinating workflow through the department and delegating as required; coach and direct the Payroll teamServe as US Payroll subject matter expert within the HR workgroup and in Workday HRISEnsure accurate and timely processing of payroll, payroll funding, tax filing on a pay period and on-going basisCo-ordinate changes of custom reports, journals, new payroll codes as required within Workday HRISSet guidelines for payroll team, set payroll schedule, timelines/deadlines for HR and managers to provide information to payroll for processingConduct various payroll audits to ensure accuracy and quality control; work with auditors as requiredEnsure on-going, quarterly and Year-End reporting is balanced and filed in accordance with legislation and deadlines are metPerform semi-annual reviewsDouble check and approve all payroll third party payments, payroll journals and payroll funding documents.Approve withholding calculations for stock option plans and the input process for accurate W2 reporting. Ensure all processes documentation and compliance with Sarbanes Oxley and local, state and national regulatory agenciesEnsure the team is consistently delivering products & services up to the expected standardsDemonstrate productive analytical thinking when it comes to solutioningDemonstrate assertiveness, where appropriate, through respectful and clear communication tacticsCollaborate with team members and across functions to achieve deliverablesProvides service to internal and external partners and clients in line with our global service delivery standardsExhibit effective presentation skills through clear expression of information and appeal to the audience both aesthetically and persuasivelyPrioritize process improvement consistentlyMaintain continuous level of engagement between team, department and tower members, cross-functionally and with clients, as requiredUnderstand and apply big picture thinking to create strategic roadmaps and objectivesProvide and manage processes to support a high degree of customer service Hire and develop talent for his/her team to support organic and strategic growth Qualifications & Requirements  Minimum 10 years of payroll management experience (specifically processing and running payroll)Minimum 3 years of people management experience (in a Payroll Management capacity)FPC certification required; title: Business Development Manager
description: \r\n                            Business Development ManagerWhat more could you do? Randstad Professionals, a nationwide leader in finance, accounting, HR, legal, marketing, and sales staffing is looking for aggressive, sales focused professionals. The fast paced and competitive world of staffing will give you the opportunity to experience the rich rewards that follow hard work.   The EmployerAt Randstad Professionals, people are our business - therefore, we strive to create the best balance between achieving business goals while recognizing the career goals and needs of our employees. While we set high expectations for every associate, each one is also given the autonomy and flexibility to build relationships with clients and candidates to grow their business their way. In other words, we know that success comes in many shapes and sizes - and we celebrate differences among our people. Business Development Manager Job DutiesAs a Business Development Manager for Randstad Professionals, you will sell talent delivery services to clients, working with our Recruiters to place professional talent in our clients job orders.You will pursue, maintain and grow sales within existing Major Accounts assigned.  This position is focused primarily on selling temporary staffing however, will also sell full service (direct hire) recruiting.  The Business Development Manager works closely with Executive Recruiters and Staffing Managers in order to provide full service to our clients. The Ideal CandidateIf you are an experienced sales professional, willing and able to execute aggressive business development initiatives, with a genuine interest in learning about client organizations and providing quality solutions, while working in a team-focused environment, you have what it takes to be a successful Business Development Manager for Randstad Professionals. We help you reach your greatest potential by providing best in class training programs throughout your career.  Job Requirements- Bachelors Degree or 4 years of equivalent work experience in the staffing industry- Minimum of 1 year staffing or recruiting experience Preferred- Minimum of 3 years of business to business sales experience   Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do" at Randstad Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: CyberSecurity Specialist
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Responsible for the security of the enterprise infrastructure focusing on management, prevention, analysis and response to cybersecurity incidents. Work with the CISO in collaboration with industry experts to evaluate and implement technical solutions and planned mitigation strategies to protect the Companys information assets and technology. Essential Functions \\ Duties:  Perform threat, risk and vulnerability assessments and analysis. Provide  recommendations to protect the business against industry known threatsEnsure all Cybersecurity threat response strategies are integrated with governance and compliance processes.Monitor for events leading to an Information Security incident as well as follow the latest trends within information technology security.Promote security awareness for employees; develop security policies and procedures, and provide updates and reports to management.Apply computer forensics methodologies to assist in breach remediation and ensure policies and processes remain current and consistent with regulatory requirements.Prepare statistics for monthly reporting.    Required Skills:  Minimum of 10 years experience in Cybersecurity, including at least 2 years in secure programing practices.College degree and CISSP certification, or other industry recognized security certification.Management and leadership ability, and strong, problem-solving and critical thinking skills.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Experience with a wide range of computer systems and security tools.Should have strong incident response back ground including at least 2 years experience in computer forensics, particularly data acquisition.     location: New York, New York  job type: Permanent  work hours: 9 to 5  education: No Degree Required     responsibilities:  Responsible for the security of the enterprise infrastructure focusing on management, prevention, analysis and response to cybersecurity incidents. title: Project Manager I
description: \r\n                            job summary: Job description Our projects span the globe and require managers to keep the big picture in focus while being able to dive into the unique implementation challenges we face daily. As a Project Manager you will have a grounded understanding of project and program management principles, preferably through direct project experience.  You will be versed in risk management and escalate issues and anticipate project specific risks to ensure timely and on-budget implementations. Youre excellent at communicating to all levels and are comfortable explaining your teams analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing technical estimates with the technical team and business partners. The Project Manager will play an integral role in helping to ensure our full compliance with our Peanuts Removal initiative. Summary of responsibilities:   Familiar with a variety of the IT concepts, practices, and procedures.  Sets deadlines, assigns responsibilities, and monitors and summarizes progress of project funding (budget, actuals and forecasts).  Builds and maintains working relationships with team members, vendors, and other departments involved in the projects. Prepares reports for upper management regarding status of project.  Works closely with technical teams to develop and track milestones and schedules.  Identifies and coordinates heavy interdependencies to ensure timing and alignment of releases, hardware, and resources.  Ensures communication, coordination of activities, and issue resolution amongst core team members, senior management and other stakeholders.  Coordinate monthly program meeting with program participants.  This includes developing the agenda, creating meeting material, presentation of information and answering topical questions.  Maintain weekly regional workgroup meetings for non-US program participants.  Oversee monthly Steering Committee meetings.  This includes developing the agenda, creating meeting material, shepherding the material through executive reviews, presentation of information and answering topical questions, creating meeting minutes and distributing them to Steering Committee members.  Reviews/approves financials: compares actuals to forecast and works with teams to identify/resolve any discrepancies.  Develop material for various ad hoc meetings and presentations.  Required experience   5+ years related work experience in project management  Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical abilities  Proficient in MS Office suite of applications including Microsoft Project, Visio  Familiar with a variety of the IT concepts, practices, and procedures  Experience with issue, risk and change management  Preferred experience   PMP  Experience in investments, financial services industries  Adept at working with distributed, global teams  Agile/Lean familiarity or experience      location: NYC, New York  job type: Contract  work hours: 9 to 6  education: Bachelors     responsibilities:  We have a 6 month renewable contract for a Project Manager 1 with a client of ours in NYC, NY. Youre excellent at communicating to all levels and are comfortable explaining your teams analyses and recommendations to executives as you are discussing technical estimates with the technical team and business partners. The Project Manager will play an integral role in helping to ensure our full compliance with our Peanuts Removal initiative. Summary of responsibilities:   Familiar with a variety of the IT concepts, practices, and procedures.  Sets deadlines, assigns responsibilities, and monitors and summarizes progress of project funding (budget, actuals and forecasts).  Builds and maintains working relationships with team members, vendors, and other departments involved in the projects. Prepares reports for upper management regarding status of project.  Works closely with technical teams to develop and track milestones and schedules.  Identifies and coordinates heavy interdependencies to ensure timing and alignment of releases, hardware, and resources.  Ensures communication, coordination of activities, and issue resolution amongst core team members, senior management and other stakeholders.  Coordinate monthly program meeting with program participants.  This includes developing the agenda, creating meeting material, presentation of information and answering topical questions.  Maintain weekly regional workgroup meetings for non-US program participants.  Oversee monthly Steering Committee meetings.  This includes developing the agenda, creating meeting material, shepherding the material through executive reviews, presentation of information and answering topical questions, creating meeting minutes and distributing them to Steering Committee members.  Reviews/approves financials: compares actuals to forecast and works with teams to identify/resolve any discrepancies.  Develop material for various ad hoc meetings and presentations.  Required experience   5+ years related work experience in project management  Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills  Excellent communication, interpersonal, and analytical abilities  Proficient in MS Office suite of applications including Microsoft Project, Visio  Familiar with a variety of the IT concepts, practices, and procedures  Experience with issue, risk and change management  Preferred experience   PMP  Experience in investments, financial services industries  Adept at working with distributed, global teams  Agile/Lean familiarity or experience     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Account Manager
description: \r\n                                    ACCOUNT MANAGER  - RANDSTAD TECHNOLOGIES Why work for Randstad Technologies?  We have been consistently recognized as one of the "Best Places to Work" - and with good reason. Were a company of experts with a clear dedication to those we serve. We rank on the most recent Inavero "Best of Staffing" list for earning high marks on client and candidate satisfaction. And in an ever-evolving industry, were constantly refreshing our expertise in the field to deliver the full-service capabilities necessary for IT professionals to succeed and stay ahead. We take the time to build relationships with clients and candidates so we can truly understand what they need - and how we can help them succeed. Our people drive our business, connecting talented IT professionals with organizations where they can produce results. Thats why our expertise has impact. Responsibilities of Account Manager (inside/outside sales):- Work with Client to obtain qualified job requirements and educate Client on Randstad Technologies service offerings and process. - Proactively initiate new client partnerships with targeted accounts & org chart development- Promote Client development and build relationships with prospective Clients through office visits, presentations and negotiations. - Utilize strategic client hunting practices, industry/market analysis, internal communication, external promotions and constant in-depth client analysis to uncover revenue opportunities - Establish opportunities to present our value-proposition to strategic Senior Executive and Management level contacts- Responsible for increasing the number of qualified hiring contacts in database. - Maximize existing relationships by engaging clients as their primary touch point within Randstad Technologies.- Interface with internal teams to ensure all lines of business within Randstad Technologies are effectively represented to our customer base.- Update and maintain Client information in accordance to Randstad Technologies standards - Track vendor agreements and complete accurate invoicing information. - Locate contractors working at Client locations and refer them to recruiting (recruitment lead generation)- Meet or exceed weekly goal expectations Business Development:- Identify potential opportunities with companies through research, referrals, networking and cold calling.- Initiate relationships with prospective clients by researching jobs and organizations and connecting with key stakeholders.- Present information related to recruiting and staffing services and utilize business development strategies to capitalize on new opportunities and drive growth.- Plan and prioritize activities based on criticality. Required Skills of Account Manager (inside/outside sales):- A strong work ethic and sense of commitment. - Past history of exceeding personal individual goals while working in a team environment.- Able to work in a very fast paced, dynamic environment. - Closing skills and the ability to build lasting relationships built on honest and integrity. - Excellent communication, presentation and customer service skills. - Bachelors degree is preferred  Compensation and Benefits:  - As an Account Manager you will receive a competitive base salary and uncapped commission potential.  - You will also be eligible to enroll into our Health, Dental and Vision Insurance as well as Life and AD&D coverage and 401K plan.  You can also benefit from our Cell Phone Discount Plans and Gym Reimbursement Program.   At Randstad Technologies, we recognize the need for individual and corporate responsibility. We are committed to improving the quality of life and enhancing the vitality of the communities in which we operate.  Randstad Technologies provides support through various Community Outreach Programs, including a Corporate Giving Program, an Office Matching Program, and an employee Volunteer Day, where employees are encouraged to volunteer at a non-profit organization of their choice.In addition, we hope to reward you with some great programs like:- Randstad Technologies Stars, Sales Contests, and High Spread Contests - Presidents Club - Anniversary Program - Leaders in Training Program  About Randstad Technologies: For almost 3 decades, Randstad Technologies has been connecting companies around the world to customized technology solutions that meet and surpass objectives. We combine our deep industry expertise with our broad range of full-service capabilities - recruitment, consulting, projects, outsourcing - to deliver the right fit to our clients and candidates. From recruitment to technology solutions aimed at protecting and maximizing the value of technology investments, we power our clients success - and drive our candidates growth.We have achieved this by providing a fun, supportive work environment where our employees are encouraged to reach their potential.  At Randstad Technologies we believe the best investment we can make is hiring quality people. You provide the hard work and dedication to excellence and we will provide you with the tools, training, and support necessary to help you become a success in your career. We empower our employees to pursue challenging, professional growth opportunities and generously recognize and reward them for their hard work and achievements.  Join our team today and start working for a company that will help you achieve your personal, professional, and financial goals.     Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do" at Randstad. Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.                                     \n

title: Release Engineer
description: \r\n                            job summary:  THE OPPORTUNITY The Release Engineer will join our System Lifecycle Engineering team to create and maintain deployable systems artifacts across the various Tech Programs. The engineer will build (or source), maintain, and integrate the underlying technology stacks that support software builds and/or application deployments. The candidate will also serve as a subject matter expert (SME) to development teams and will act as Level3 support for Production and Operations.    location: New York, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $180,000 - 190,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 6  education: No Degree Required     responsibilities:  YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES The Release Engineer is responsible for architecting, maintaining, and streamlining our automated build and release pipeline from code compilation, automated testing, to deploying releases to multiple environments. The candidate will also be responsible for defining best practices for source control management, creating and maintaining documentation of the build/release process, and investigating tools and processes and integrating them so that they can improve the reliability, stability and efficiency with which we release our services.    qualifications:  -Release Engineering Function for System Lifecycle Engineering (80%) -Audit existing tools and practices to develop and execute a plan for standardizing and streamlining the automated build and release pipeline -Integrate with existing frameworks to ensure our Engineering Best Practices are incorporated into the release pipeline -Creating and maintaining documentation of the build/release process -Consolidate and organize our SCM (Bitbucket) and ARM (Artifactory) systems and define governance policies so that can be properly administered -Define, collect, aggregate, and visualize metrics that pertain to the build, deploy, and run lifecycle phases -Responsible for SCM and ARM tools Support & Training (20%) -Working closely with the development team to integrate new deployment processes and strategies to meet our feature requirements -Assists in diagnosing and solving production issues -Provides guidance to ensure that deployment plans follow best practices    skills:  -Strong experience in source control management, specifically with Git -Experience with Jenkins and working with CI/CD -Experience in scripting in Python, Ruby, Groovy, or similar languages -Proficient with Unix/Linux and bash scripting -Understanding of DevOps technologies and frameworks -Knowledge of Quality Assurance procedures and processes -Knowledge of Agile Methodologies and principles     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Graphic Designer II
description: \r\n                            job summary: Project Overview:   Wazes User Acquisition team is constantly needing to refresh and push the boundaries of the creatives used in evergreen paid acquisition campaigns for three products: Waze, Waze Carpool and Waze Local.   The team also constantly experiments with new visuals inside the app stores and in Wazes website (waze.com and sub-pages) to increase the percentage of visitors who decide to install our free apps.   About you Waze is looking for a strong designer that has experience with, understanding of and a passion for building performance creative that works.  We are looking for a passionate and tech savvy designer to work with Wazes global User Acquisition team responsible for bringing hundreds of thousands of new Waze and Waze Carpool users every month, all over the world, via evergreen campaigns in advertising networks and via experiments in Wazes owned channels.   In this newly created role, you will be charged with creating and optimizing high volume of visuals for paid campaigns in Google ads, Facebook/Instagram ads and Snapchat ads.   These campaigns run in multiple countries and are always-on, focused primarily on performance - e.g. mobile app install campaigns aiming for the highest scale at the lowest cost per acquisition.   You will also be creating key visuals for a/b tests in the Google Play Store, App Store and waze.com website, all aimed at increasing the volume of visitors who decide to install and try our free apps.   The right candidate for this role must be an innovative, progressive thinker who can constantly conceive, execute and adapt creatives that result in strong performance.  Someone who can communicate technology in a way everyone can understand, thats genuine, playful and charming.  The role requires great execution, constant innovation, attention to details and fearlessness, solving challenges with creativity while keeping the user in mind.   At Waze, we leave all egos at the door and concentrate on the job at hand.   We value passionate, down to earth, "can do" people who enjoy fine-tuning small details, without losing sight of the big picture.   We are looking for the type of person who feels uncomfortable when a day goes by without achieving something impactful.  Someone who is driven to get things done and views obstacles as an exciting challenge that demands a creative solution.   Above all else, this role requires someone who takes great pride in their work and is inspired and motivated by their role in improving the way millions of people drive and commute worldwide.         location: New York, New York  job type: Contract  salary: $46.66 - 51.53 per hour  work hours: 9 to 6  education: Bachelors     responsibilities: Overall Responsibilities:    Produce high-quality, performance-oriented visuals that bring the Waze brand to life, are interesting, fun and relevant.   These visuals must work from a performance point of view, reducing costs of acquisition in paid channels (e.g. Google and Facebook ads) or increasing conversion rates in owned channels (e.g. Wazes app store listing).   You will work in partnership with Wazes brand & marketing teams to ensure consistency for our brand and our users.   Top Daily Responsibilities: Conceive, create and adapt new visuals for user acquisition channels Brainstorm new campaigns and tests with larger team.     qualifications:   Excellent communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills.  Ability to communicate complex, sometimes abstract, design concepts clearly and persuasively.    skills:  Required Skills:   Proven ability to deliver exceptional design at high volumes under clear deadlines.  Experience with performance marketing campaigns.   A solid understanding of design to achieve business objectives while keeping a high quality level for aesthetics.  Ability to solve visual problems. Detail-oriented and flawless execution.  Primarily digital experience, with a good eye for the impact caused by potential animations, interactions and transitions.   Constant focus on big ideas, thinking beyond just the execution. Interest for data and results.   A portfolio demonstrating excellence in design. It should showcase your work, provide detail of your role on each project and show examples of creatives that worked in performance-oriented projects.  Nice to have Skills (not required):   3 years experience working on visual design in agencies or tech B2C products.   Highly productive, constantly striving to optimize your workflow to become more efficient and effective.   Ability to collaborate with photographers, motion graphics designers and film producers.     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n
