The ideal candidate will be able to review, monitor, analyze and report on financial data on cost, productivity & inventory.    location: West Harrison, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $70,000 - 80,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors degree  experience: 5 Years     responsibilities:  Partner with Operations to update and review standard and actual costsReview monthly manufacturing cost activity during monthly close cycleMonitor cycle counting processes and variancesValidate inventory cost reportingIdentify possible opportunities for improving the efficiency of productionPartner with operations to be an onsite resource for physical inventory counts, review and analyze overstock and obsolete productsAssist in consolidated financial budget/forecastAssist in cash flow reporting and forecastingConstruct, validate and monitor data accumulation for financial reportingProvide cost analysis results to assist senior management in decision-making or other financial initiatives.Perform variance analysis between actual and standard costs.Monitor, analyze and report on inventory valuation, production and various other costs.Provide productivity analysis.Review and analyze product margins for all customers and support Sales department with timely reports.Review reporting for trends and investigate abnormalitiesPerform other related duties as required to meet the goals and objectives of the company and Finance Department   qualifications:  5+ years in a similar role relating to Cost AccountingBachelors degree in Accounting, Finance or related fieldAdvanced Excel skills   skills: General Ledger, Cost Accounting, Inventory, Inventory Physical, Cost Reporting, Inventory - Physical, Cost of Goods Sold    Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Technical Recruiter
description: \r\n                            Why work for Randstad Technologies?  We have been consistently recognized as one of the "Best Places to Work" - and with good reason. Were a company of experts with a clear dedication to those we serve. We rank on the most recent Inavero "Best of Staffing" list for earning high marks on client and candidate satisfaction. And in an ever-evolving industry, were constantly refreshing our expertise in the field to deliver the full-service capabilities necessary for IT professionals to succeed and stay ahead. We take the time to build relationships with clients and candidates so we can truly understand what they need - and how we can help them succeed. Our people drive our business, connecting talented IT professionals with organizations where they can produce results. Thats why our expertise has impact.Required Skills of Technical Recruiter (inside sales):- A strong work ethic and sense of commitment. - Past history of exceeding personal individual goals while working in a team environment.- Able to work in a very fast paced, dynamic environment. - Closing skills and the ability to build lasting relationships built on honest and integrity. - Excellent communication, presentation and customer service skills. - Bachelors degree is preferred   About Randstad Technologies: For almost 3 decades, Randstad Technologies has been connecting companies around the world to customized technology solutions that meet and surpass objectives. We combine our deep industry expertise with our broad range of full-service capabilities - recruitment, consulting, projects, outsourcing - to deliver the right fit to our clients and candidates. From recruitment to technology solutions aimed at protecting and maximizing the value of technology investments, we power our clients success - and drive our candidates growth. We have achieved this by providing a fun, supportive work environment where our employees are encouraged to reach their potential.  At Randstad Technologies we believe the best investment we can make is hiring quality people. You provide the hard work and dedication to excellence and we will provide you with the tools, training, and support necessary to help you become a success in your career. We empower our employees to pursue challenging, professional growth opportunities and generously recognize and reward them for their hard work and achievements.  Join our team today and start working for a company that will help you achieve your personal, professional, and financial goals.  Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do" at Randstad Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.    \n

title: Analyst
description: \r\n                            This position is primarily accountable for owning & executing responsibilities associated with the continued development, implementation, and propagation of sound IT Financial Management for IT in the Americas Zone. Consolidate IT Trend & Budget cycle submissions to Corporate Finance. Monitor and analyze IT actual spending activity relative to budgets/ trends. Work with IT Budget Owners to prepare future year capital project requests. Monitor and report on the status of current year IT CAPEX and OPEX projects. Responsible for maintaining proper project business case preparation, holding project managers accountable for updating PPM tools. Consolidate budget and trend documentation for presentation to IT senior management. Interact with IT country leads for the Americas Zone. Assist in consolidation ofResponsibilities:Advocate for the value of IT, communicate effectively all IT spending, understand the impact to Countries, Divisions and brands.o Drive Group Financial Norms compliance IT Budget Process and PPM process Compliance, implement industry best practices.o Communicate CAPEX/OPEX instructions and create templates for budget owners.o Update project depreciation and YTD spending for IT departments, prepare spending models for IT projects.o Prepare consolidation of all local country IT Budgets for Zone IT Controller.o Proactively update Financial documentation and project business cases for IT projects.o Coordinate month end/ year-end financial closing, report on any varianceso Development of metrics / dashboards that enable IT Leaders to clearly measure IT effectiveness, budgetary trends and financial Project status.o Track and help manage IT Project Capital spend and project status, update necessary reports and dashboards.o Develop tools and templates in Excel to drive IT Finance consolidation.Working hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PMSkills:Bachelors degree requiredPreferred concentration in finance/accounting2-4 years experienceQualifications:Bachelors degree requiredPreferred concentration in finance/accounting2-4 years?? experienceBilingual (English / Spanish or Portugese) a plusExcellent computer skills in Excel and WordExcellent verbal and written skillsFinancial reporting or IT Finance experienceInterested Please apply and email christina.bruscia@randstadusa.comRandstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. title: Administrative Assistant
description: \r\n                            If you are an experienced and proactive project assistant interested in starting your career in Construction as an Administrative Assistant position in the Central Long Island area please apply today or send your resume directly to courtney.blair@randstadusa.com In this position you will work collaboratively with your team on specific short and long-term projects. In this role, you will oversee tasks delegated to you by the project manager, coordinate with all necessary vendors and service providers, and generally ensure that the project is moving forward on time and on budget. You will need to be highly organized, adaptable, and able to prioritize tasks while working independently. The ability to motivate others and keep them on task in a positive and encouraging manner is also a must-have skill in this position.Responsibilities:The role would provide administrative support to the Project Team, ensuring the effective and smooth running of the day to day operations. The minimum education requirement is a high school diploma or equivalent.  Knowledge of Sage Construction and Textura would be a plus but the prospective candidate must be proficient in Microsoft Word and Excel.--Work collaboratively with the project manager and team to maximize productivity--Collaborate with the whole project team, contributing to the entire project lifecycle--Organize and monitor schedules and see that deadlines are met--Coordinate efforts within the team and with outside consultants efficiently--Report updates verbally and in written form to management--Monitor budget and help ensure resources are used efficiently--Help discern requirements and assign tasks to team members--Complete any necessary administrative tasks, such as research and email--Demonstrate commitment to clients?? needs and confidentiality continuously--Project Assistant Requirements and QualificationsWorking hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PMSkills:--Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills--Keen attention to detail and an aptitude for problem solving--Able to proactively address potential issues--Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office--Significant hands-on experience with industry-specific software--Collaborative working style and team-player attitude--Positive and encouraging personality--Able to work independently with little supervision--Highly motivated with a strong work ethicReliable, trustworthy, and committed to teams successOutstanding organizational skills and ability to prioritize tasksAble to thrive in a high-volume, deadline-driven work environmentQualifications:This full-time position would suit someone who is professional, self-motivated with great communication skills, organized, has an eye for detail, and a willingness to learn. This position will require occasional daily travel to project job sites.--Associates or Bachelors degree in a relevant field required--Additional certifications that exemplify a desire for continued education preferred--Minimum 2 years relevant work work experience in the industryRandstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. title: Recruiter
description: \r\n                            We have an exciting new opportunity for a University Recruiting Coordinator in the Parsippany, NJ area. This is a long term temporary role running for approximately 6 months with the potential go permanent!Responsibilities:- Responsible for overseeing the N. America University Recruitment programs and maintains UR metrics. - Coordinates candidate interview schedules with the business. - Coordinate all aspects of Graduate assessment days onsite for cross functions. - Coordinates on campus events at Universities, ensuring business presence. - Attend select campus recruiting events with Human Resource and Business team members to help market RBs value proposition to prospective hires. - Responsible for posting job openings and ensuring appropriate approvals have been met to do so. - Manages background check process for all interns and new hires. - Monitor and maintain staffing metrics data, as well as compile weekly metrics reports for all levels and functions. Assist with other staffing metrics as needed. - Main point of contact for candidate related travel and process candidate reimbursements. - Owns Vendor Management, contract reviews, updates and record filing. - Make recommendations for building the UR program strategy taking into account best practices from Graduate program. - Manages budgets and measures effectiveness of spend for University Recruitment. - Assists Talent Acquisition and Talent Development team on additional projects as needed.Working hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PMSkills:- 3 - 5 years experience (preferably with Campus Recruiting)- Bachelors degree strongly preferred in Business Administration/Management or Human Resources. - Experience with Human Resource function is strongly desired. - Experience using an Applicant Tracking System (ATS) and HR Management System or similar database to manage candidates via the staffing process is preferred. - Ability to travel seasonally (approximately 30%) - Demonstrated ability to interact and support all employee levels. - Experience with MS Office; and Excel is preferred. - Excellent organization and follow up skills required. - Strong verbal and written communication skills. - Self-starter, highly motivated and strong attention to detail. - Team player and ability to work independently. - Must be able to work with highly confidential materials in a professional manner.Qualifications:If you are qualified and interested in this role, please apply and email your resume to brendan.sommerkorn@randstadusa.comRandstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. title: E-commerce Manager
description: \r\n                            Are you seeking a position that offers autonomy, creativity, and an opportunity to maximize growth and expansion through digital platforms? Do you have experience in the fashion industry or manufacturing? As an E-commerce Manager you will work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment that requires strong decision-making skills, flexibility and adaptability. You will be responsible for choosing among different Internet marketing strategies and deciding which is the best option. You will also be implementing new online business initiatives such as shifting from retailing to forex trading, and be able to differentiate between legitimate customers and fraudsters in real-time to prevent the business from incurring lossesComputer skills are crucial since you will spend much of your time interacting with computers and computer networks.Responsibilities:-Develops and implements a strategic plan to drive Internet sales for a business or company-Develop affiliate marketing programs-Create and maintain an online business plan for various platforms-Stay up to date on software or data trends-Keep current knowledge of online trends-Update website for new mobile or computer systems to appeal to current and future customers -Provide analytic reports of online sales-Search Engine Optimization (SEO), PPC,CMS, Social Media, Email marketing.-Report to top executives about income generation and recommending new promotions to increase sales-Negotiate with social media organizations for the more cost effective way to market and promote products and services is an important duty of this position-Responsible for all online activities-Undertaking a research to understand the demographic targets, search engine traffic, media buying, etc.-Financial planning and preparing of budgets-Demonstrate project strategies and plans to the higher officialsWorking hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PMSkills:-Bachelors degree in fields such as marketing, computer science or business information systems-Expert communication skills, both verbal as well as written-Creative with a strategic mind set-Flexible to changing conditions and possessing high level of integrity-Professional attitude with clients as well as colleagues-Expert knowledge of various business principles such as marketing strategy, financial analysis, and supply chain oversight-Expert understanding of different technological components of online commerce-Knowledge of database creation and management-Knowledge of search engine optimization tactics, data mining, and security issuesQualifications:We are seeking candiodates with excellent analytical, creative, and leadership skills to join our growing team.Randstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. Our experienced agents will listen carefully to your employment needs and then work diligently to match your skills and qualifications to the right job and company. Whether youre looking for temporary, temporary-to-permanent or permanent opportunities, no one works harder for you than Randstad. title: Account Executive
description: \r\n                            Why work for Randstad Technologies?  We have been consistently recognized as one of the "Best Places to Work" - and with good reason. Were a company of experts with a clear dedication to those we serve. We rank on the most recent Inavero "Best of Staffing" list for earning high marks on client and candidate satisfaction. We take the time to build relationships with clients and candidates so we can truly understand what they need - and how we can help them succeed. Our people drive our business, connecting talented IT professionals with organizations where they can produce results. Thats why our expertise has impact.Required Skills of Account Manager (inside/outside sales):- A strong work ethic and sense of commitment. - Past history of exceeding personal individual goals while working in a team environment.- Able to work in a very fast paced, dynamic environment. - Closing skills and the ability to build lasting relationships built on honest and integrity. - Excellent communication, presentation and customer service skills. - Bachelors degree is preferred   About Randstad Technologies: For almost 3 decades, Randstad Technologies has been connecting companies around the world to customized technology solutions that meet and surpass objectives. We combine our deep industry expertise with our broad range of full-service capabilities - recruitment, consulting, projects, outsourcing - to deliver the right fit to our clients and candidates. From recruitment to technology solutions aimed at protecting and maximizing the value of technology investments, we power our clients success - and drive our candidates growth.We have achieved this by providing a fun, supportive work environment where our employees are encouraged to reach their potential.  At Randstad Technologies we believe the best investment we can make is hiring quality people. You provide the hard work and dedication to excellence and we will provide you with the tools, training, and support necessary to help you become a success in your career. We empower our employees to pursue challenging, professional growth opportunities and generously recognize and reward them for their hard work and achievements.  Join our team today and start working for a company that will help you achieve your personal, professional, and financial goals.   Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do" at Randstad Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled  Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.  \n

title: Labor and Delivery RN
description: \r\n                            Its time to get on the road! Were in need of Labor and Delivery (LD) Travel Nurses to fill immediate openings at a hospital in Suffern, NY. If this sounds great to you, and you have 2+ years of experience, keep reading and well make sure you get all the details.  What will I do? The Labor and Delivery Unit is an unit for laboring mother. This department or area in the hospital is where hospital staff care for mothers before active labor, active labor, and during the final phase of labor.  Labor and Delivery units can also care for the mother and baby after delivery, also referred to as Labor, Delivery, Recovery, Postpartum (LDRP). A mother and baby may stay for days, depending on the type of delivery and recovery. Post Partum units can be separate depending on the size of the facility.  What are the benefits? Weekly take-home pay between $20 and $60 per hour including per- diems-top-tier benefits that help you focus on taking care of your patients and know youre being taken care of, too.  What else do I need to know? A qualified Labor and Delivery (LD) Travel Nurse will have a Bachelor of Science in Nursing and hold a current/active license as a registered nurse in the state of NY, in addition to current certifications in BLS and other unit specific certifications. You must be certified in Intermediate or Advanced Fetal Monitoring, Neonatal Resuscitation and Advanced Cardiac Life Support. You may also be required to complete a minimum number of years of clinical experience in a hospital setting.  Randstad Healthcare is your career concierge-savvy, smart and right by your side when youre considering a new position, city or job title. Let us help you make your next move: Get in touch with one of our Career Agents today!Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Business Development Manager
description: \r\n                            Business Development ManagerWhat more could you do? Randstad Professionals, a nationwide leader in finance, accounting, HR, legal, marketing, and sales staffing is looking for aggressive, sales focused professionals. The fast paced and competitive world of staffing will give you the opportunity to experience the rich rewards that follow hard work.   The EmployerAt Randstad Professionals, people are our business - therefore, we strive to create the best balance between achieving business goals while recognizing the career goals and needs of our employees. While we set high expectations for every associate, each one is also given the autonomy and flexibility to build relationships with clients and candidates to grow their business their way. In other words, we know that success comes in many shapes and sizes - and we celebrate differences among our people. Business Development Manager Job DutiesAs a Business Development Manager for Randstad Professionals, you will sell talent delivery services to clients, working with our Recruiters to place professional talent in our clients job orders.You will pursue, maintain and grow sales within existing Major Accounts assigned.  This position is focused primarily on selling temporary staffing however, will also sell full service (direct hire) recruiting.  The Business Development Manager works closely with Executive Recruiters and Staffing Managers in order to provide full service to our clients. The Ideal CandidateIf you are an experienced sales professional, willing and able to execute aggressive business development initiatives, with a genuine interest in learning about client organizations and providing quality solutions, while working in a team-focused environment, you have what it takes to be a successful Business Development Manager for Randstad Professionals. We help you reach your greatest potential by providing best in class training programs throughout your career.  Job Requirements- Bachelors Degree or 4 years of equivalent work experience in the staffing industry- Minimum of 1 year staffing or recruiting experience Preferred- Minimum of 3 years of business to business sales experience Salary Range & Benefits- Unlimited commission potential- 401k + company match Application ProcessA Randstad Corporate Recruiter will review your application and contact qualified candidates for a phone interview. We will even give you the opportunity to bring your resume to life with a recorded video interview to share with everyone involved in the hiring process. Our best candidates will interview face to face with the Managing Director in their market. Get to know us and find out "What More Could You Do " at Randstad Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Insurance Producer
description: \r\n                            Are you looking to work for a company that offers upward growth, autonomy, and unlimited earning potential with a comfortable base salary? Are you outgoing, professional, and ready to take on new challenges? Do you have experience with commercial lines insurance and posses a NY state insurance license? If so this may be the perfect position for you! A boutique insurance firm is seeking dedicated and ambitious individuals to join a team driven family oriented environment that focuses on growing business and developing long lasting partnerships.Responsibilities:-Develops base for long-term sources of clients by using referrals, occupational, and special-interest groups to compile lists of prospects.-Approaches potential clients by utilizing mailings and phone solicitation; title: Pediatric RN
description: \r\n                            Were searching for Pediatric Travel Nurses to fill immediate openings at a facility in Edison, NJ. If this sounds great to you, and you have 2+ years of experience, keep reading and well make sure you get all the details.  What will I do? Pediatric Travel Nurses monitor and assess general patient health, in addition to administering medications, and initiating and managing IVs. You will also be responsible for admitting, educating and discharging adolescent patients, and acting as the liaison between the patient, patients families and physicians, as necessary.  What are the benefits? Weekly take-home pay between $20 and $60 per hour, including per- diems-top-tier benefits that help you focus on taking care of your patients and know youre being taken care of, too.  A qualified Pediatric Travel Nurse will have a Bachelor of Science in Nursing or Associates Degree in Nursing and hold a current/active license as a registered nurse in the state of NJ, in addition to current certifications in BLS (Basic Life Support), CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) certification, PALS (Pediatric Advanced Life Support) certification and other unit-specific core certifications. You must also complete the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEX-RN). Advanced certification can be obtained as a certified medical-surgical nurse (CMSRN).  Randstad Healthcare is your career concierge-savvy, smart and right by your side when youre considering a new position, city or job title. description: \r\n                            job summary:  A leading provider of Enterprise Cloud and Managed Services has a need for a Corporate Senior Legal Counsel to join their team in New Jersey. This is an exciting opportunity to be the primary legal point of contact at a growing technology company. Reporting to the President, the Corporate Senior Legal Counsel will be providing legal support to the various internal teams including Sales, Compliance, Security, Finance and Humane Resources.    location: Edison, New Jersey  job type: Permanent  salary: $150,000 - 220,000  per year  work hours: 8 to 5  education: Law Degree  experience: 5 Years     responsibilities:  Support and/or lead the negotiation of million-dollar service agreements related to the sale of cloud hosting, and software implementations.Draft and negotiate an array of agreements such as, employment contracts, contractor agreements, supplier agreements, leases, NDAs and IT agreements.Manage disputes combining your business acumen and experience with your risk mitigation abilities.Train internal stakeholders in order to improve their understanding of legal concepts to help prevent litigation.Participate and contribute in meetings with senior management and clients.Communicate to Operations the necessity of Compliance and the adherence to the various undertakings we may have with our clients.Lead efforts to address continuing improvement to standard agreements   qualifications:  Five (5) plus years of experience practicing commercial transactional law, with at least 3 years of practice within a renowned law firm.An active license to practice law.Proven experience or knowledge of the IT industry.Excellent legal and business acumen.Strong interpersonal and persuasion skills.The ability to work autonomously.The ability to work flexible, extended and/or irregular working hours in line with business demands, together with an ability to travel on short notice. description: \r\n                            job summary:  Lease Administration Manager  The Lease Administration Manager will oversee the corporate portfolio of real estate and review revise and abstract various types of agreements in regard to real estate management and leases.    location: Valhalla, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $90,000 - 95,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors degree  experience: 8 Years     responsibilities:  Provide and support companys processes in the acquisition, disposition and maintenance of commercial leases; including tracking, reporting, negotiating and monitoring transactions.Initiate the evaluation of expiring leases in adequate time to position company in a favorable time frame to negotiate the best transaction alternative.Lead the data collection, evaluation and planning to effective utilization of space.Interface with landlords and business units of occupied sites to maintain positive relationships and effective management of lease obligations.Work with the legal department and companys broker to prepare documentation and execution of transaction of all degree of complexity to ensure best value to the company.Provide direction on business terms from request for proposals through final LOI.Research and interpret lease language in consultation with attorneys and provide information and guidance related to real estate and lease matters.Provide effective communication to other real estate representatives and business units.Review lease document and provide accurate and valuable direction on business terms as well as identify potential problems in leases and resolve them quickly.Ensure rent processing is accurate. Review and approve operating expense reconciliations.  Work with 3 rd  party vendor, as needed to complete in depth audits.Oversee real estate database management and administration.Responsible for database and audit vendor contracts.Coordinate and maintain lease records including leases subleases, inter-company agreements, estoppels, SNDAs, amendments, etc.Scope of Position:   qualifications:  4 year degree - Business, Finance, or Real Estate8-10 year previous work experience in a similar position.Expert knowledge of Excel. Advanced knowledge of Word, Power Point and MS ProjectAbility to develop detailed financial analysis; Strong analytical skills.Demonstrate ability to communicate and present business cases, rational and ROI.Demonstrate an understanding of revenue and cost implications on the profitability of a business.Demonstrate understanding of lease terms (triple net rent, gross rent, CAM capital vs. expense, base year, etc.)Excellent written and verbal communication skills to ensure strong collaboration between different functions.Attention to detail, self-directed, organized and efficient at time management. Able to handle multiple projects simultaneously. title: Maintenance Mechanic
description: \r\n                            SummaryIndustrial Maintenance Technician combines the knowledge of mechanical technology with knowledge of electrical and electronic circuits. They operate, test, and maintain unmanned, automated, robotic, or electro-mechanical equipment. Will install, maintain, and repair automated machinery. The technician should be familiar with VFDs, gearboxes, reducers, conveyors and pumps, as well as pneumatic and hydraulic systems.Responsibilities:Duties and responsibilities- Expedites the reentry of down equipment within a manufacturing environment to working condition. Works solo and as part of a team- Read blueprints, schematics, and diagrams to determine the method and sequence of assembly of a part, machine, or piece of equipment- Inspect parts for proper fitting- Repair and calibrate hydraulic and pneumatic assemblies- Test the performance of electro-mechanical assemblies using test instruments such as multi-meters, volt and amp meters- Installs electronic parts and hardware, using soldering equipment and hand toolsWorking hours: 2:00 PM - 10:00 PMSkills:QualificationsMust have a high school diploma or GED. Technical trade education, military training or technical college preferredMinimum of 4 years experience in related field with proven industry experience, beverage experience a plusAbility and willingness to work 8, 10 or 12 hour shifts and the flexibility to work a schedule that may include days, evenings, weekends or holidaysQualifications:Maintenance Mechanic experience requiredRandstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. description: \r\n                            If you are an experienced and proactive project assistant interested in starting your career in Construction as an Administrative Assistant position in the Central Long Island area please apply today or send your resume directly to diana.berlingieri@randstadusa.com In this position you will work collaboratively with your team on specific short and long-term projects. title: Clinical Trial Associate
description: \nJob Title:  Clinical Trial Associate Position Description  The Contract Clinical Trial Associate provides clinical study administrative support and Trial Master File (TMF) support for clinical operations. The incumbent also provides support to clinical operations by reviewing vendor invoices for accuracy against budget, tracking vendor payments and taking meeting minutes during project team meetings.The incumbent works cross-functionally with internal departments and external resources on Clinical Development related issues. The Contract Clinical Trial Associate supports adherence to relevant regulatory requirements and company Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) as appropriate.   Position Responsibilities  Assists with preparing and editing, tracking, and routing clinical development documents, e.g., clinical protocols, informed consents, etc., as requested.  Assists with development and production of study materials, essential documents, presentations, reports, submissions, articles, and other materials; prepares clinical study conduct binders, track and file routine clinical study documents, either generated internally or received from Clinical Research Organizations (CROs), including, but not limited to: meeting agendas, minutes, status or patient trackers, patient screening logs and other documents as appropriate.Reviews vendor invoices for accuracy against budget.Liaises with Finance, or delegates, to ensure payments are made and tracked.Assists in preparation for regulatory audits or partnering discussion.Quality checks of clinical TMF documents, including clinical study site documents, email correspondence, training materials, and other study documents; generates filing indexes and maintains currents lists of correspondence.Provides appropriate administrative support, version control, and document tracking for SOPs, other documents maintained under Clinical Control.Performs other tasks and assignments as needed and specified by management.  Position Requirements  Bachelors degree and minimum 5 years of Clinical Development/Operations support experience in a pharmaceutical, biotechnology, or related environment or a recognized equivalent of education and experience.Familiarity with clinical trial study documents.Knowledge of Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) guidelines.Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (MS Project, a plus).Excellent verbal and written communication and skills.Ability to work independently and collaboratively, as required, in a fast-paced, matrixed, team environment consisting of internal and external team members.Analytical thinker with excellent problem solving skills and the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Excellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projects.Experience with TMFs. Experience interacting with CROs. Benefits   Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance  401K Plan with Company Match  Life and AD&D Insurance       Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Med Surg RN
description: \r\n                            Its time to get on the road! Were in need of Med-Surg Travel Nurses to fill immediate openings at a hospital in Buffao, NY. If this sounds great to you, and you have 2+ years of experience, keep reading and well make sure you get all the details.  What will I do? Med-Surg Travel Nurses monitor and assess general patient health, in addition to administering medications, and initiating and managing IVs. You will also be responsible for admitting, educating and discharging patients, and acting as the liaison between the patient, patient family and physicians, as necessary.  What are the benefits? Weekly take-home pay between $20 and $60 per hour, including per- diems-top-tier benefits that help you focus on taking care of your patients and know youre being taken care of, too.  A qualified Med-Surg Travel Nurse will have a Bachelor of Science in Nursing or Associates Degree in Nursing and hold a current/active license as a registered nurse in the state of NY, in addition to current certifications in BLS (Basic Life Support), CPR (Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation) certification and other unit-specific core certifications. You must also complete the National Council Licensure Examination (NCLEX-RN). Advanced certification can be obtained as a certified medical-surgical nurse (CMSRN).  Randstad Healthcare is your career concierge-savvy, smart and right by your side when youre considering a new position, city or job title. Let us help you make your next move: Get in touch with one of our Career Agents today!Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Labor and Delivery RN
description: \r\n                            Its time to get on the road! Were in need of Labor and Delivery (LD) Travel Nurses to fill immediate openings at a hospital in Westwood, NJ. If this sounds great to you, and you have 2+ years of experience, keep reading and well make sure you get all the details.  What will I do? The Labor and Delivery Unit is an unit for laboring mother. This department or area in the hospital is where hospital staff care for mothers before active labor, active labor, and during the final phase of labor.  Labor and Delivery units can also care for the mother and baby after delivery, also referred to as Labor, Delivery, Recovery, Postpartum (LDRP). A mother and baby may stay for days, depending on the type of delivery and recovery. Post Partum units can be separate depending on the size of the facility.  What are the benefits? Weekly take-home pay between $20 and $60 per hour including per- diems-top-tier benefits that help you focus on taking care of your patients and know youre being taken care of, too.  What else do I need to know? A qualified Labor and Delivery (LD) Travel Nurse will have a Bachelor of Science in Nursing and hold a current/active license as a registered nurse in the state of NJ, in addition to current certifications in BLS and other unit specific certifications. You must be certified in Intermediate or Advanced Fetal Monitoring, Neonatal Resuscitation and Advanced Cardiac Life Support. You may also be required to complete a minimum number of years of clinical experience in a hospital setting.  Randstad Healthcare is your career concierge-savvy, smart and right by your side when youre considering a new position, city or job title. title: Temporary HR Generalist
description: \r\n                            job summary:  The resource will work closely with on the ground HR teams, business operations, and other support teams to develop and execute multiple new programs. It will identify and resolve common site issues, as well as develop best-practices and recommendations for enhancements. This resource will be part of an integrated, cross functional team of peers that work together supporting corporate sites globally. It will study the local corporate campus needs and apply that knowledge to create materials in local language and meeting compliance requirements. This resource will help drive increased adoption of self-service while identifying where self-service and contact center (ERC) support requires improvement or enhancements. 1. Demonstrate professionalism and mastery of internal reporting systems to independently coordinate the logistics of new hire orientation including: a. Perform regular site administrative tasks such as run the on-boarding roster, manage New Hire Orientation logistics, verify right to work verifications, etc. b. Perform internal and external communication with on-boarding stakeholders: candidates, recruiters, hiring managers while identifying opportunities for improvements to local processes. c. Partner with business partners including Recruiting, ERC, HelpDesk, IT, HR and others to trouble shoot on-boarding issues to ensure a smooth on-boarding experience. d. Develop mechanisms to track on-boarding metrics, including communication SLA adherence, ticket resolution data. e. Analyze onboarding data systems including iCIMs, Excel, MyDocs, HireRight, and others. 2. Partner with local subject matter experts, VHR program management, and across Amazon businesses functions to create scalable processes, reporting solutions and influence enhancements that meet and track local compliance. 3. Design, implement, and support key datasets that provide structured and timely access to actionable business information addressing stakeholder needs. 4. Apply data analysis and research skills to identify key indicators, test hypotheses and guide actions with respect to key employee life cycle events. 5. Understand high-level business objectives and continually align work with those objectives to meet needs of business. required skills - Strong self-management skills and the ability to translate business needs into service delivery. - Ability to analyze and solve problems at their root, stepping back to understand context. - A problem solver who can make high quality judgments and decisions quickly with excellent organization skills to work across functions and upwards. - Excellent written, verbal, listening, communicating, and negotiating skills coupled with ability to comfortably and confidently present to all levels. - Ability to handle multiple competing priorities and projects in a fast-paced environment. - Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, along with customer service focus. - Organized, self-starter and a quick learner. Experience of dealing with results, metrics and data management and desire to create and build new processes. - Ability to form and influence within strong partnerships. - Provide analytical support for HR programs and build or influence content to meet local needs - Strong analytical skills are needed to surface actionable data clarifying local needs preferred skills - Experience building web-based solutions - Superior attention to detail in a fast-paced environment. - Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.    location: New York, New York  job type: Contract  salary: $25 - 28  per hour  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors degree  experience: 5 Years     responsibilities:  - Experience building web-based solutions - Superior attention to detail in a fast-paced environment. - Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.    qualifications:  - Experience building web-based solutions - Superior attention to detail in a fast-paced environment. - Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses.    skills: 401K    Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

description: \r\n                            Financial services company in Secaucus is looking for a Part Time  Quality Control Inspector  17 - 21 hours a week (Tue, Wed, Fri or Wed, Thur, Fri) to ensure accurate processing (Printing or Insertion) of all products within their area of responsibility.- The Inspector will work with all areas of Operations to ensure that every piece of printed material and mail pieces meet or exceed client quality requirements.- They also assist in the preparation of reports and make recommendations to improve quality, productivity and efficiencyResponsibilities:- Conduct sampling of work produced by Transactional and Commercial Print areas to verify that output meets client quality requirements.?? This includes verifying the integrity of statements and our production processes.- Perform a visual inspection of sorted and bucketed mail to ensure the proper separation and distribution of mail classes, thus ensuring postal and manifest integrity.- Verify the accuracy of material, media, envelopes and postage rates used for each job.- Communicate non-conformances to supervisor in a timely manner, and record all non-conformances.- Assist in verifying and reconciling jobs that are out of balance or short of material.- Demonstrate ability to work effectively in teams and learn new procedures/ applications as required.Working hours: 11:00 AM - 7:00 PMSkills:High School diploma required (or equivalent education and experience)Knowledge of a QC/Production environment. title: Business Analyst
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Role/Responsibilities  : This position represents a key role in the  IT Alignment group, which will support the delivery of transformational business and IT programs and projects that are critical to the execution of corporate business strategies and achievement of company objectives. This individual will serve as a key contact with business stakeholders to elicit requirements and validate requirements, develop and maintain strong relationships and keep stakeholders informed and engaged throughout the entire project lifecycle. This individual will also work closely with  technology teams and vendor partners to completing key process and project deliverables. This individual will also be responsible for detailed, high-quality business process documentation and analysis which meets the needs of the various project stakeholders. This individual may work on both enhancements to existing systems as well as on new development as either the primary Business Analyst or collaborating with other Business Analysts.  The Business Analyst is part of a Ratings Operations functional organization and will serve to ensure all processes and related activities are continuously aligned to the future state design.    location: New York, New York  job type: Contract  salary: $50 - 75  per hour  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors     responsibilities: Specific responsibilities for the position may include:  Manage requirements for complex projects that focus on a single system and have multiple types of stake-holders; with support from more Senior members of the teamElicit business and technical requirements from stakeholders with appropriate prioritization and dependencies identifiedMaintain a strong understanding of  business processes, strategies, IT capabilities and capacity, and filtering and prioritizing by stakeholder demand, business and regulatory impactSupport user acceptance testing; participate in validation sessionsManage and execute user acceptance plansParticipate in the relevant Agile activities around planning, grooming, elaboration, and acceptanceResolving requirements conflicts between business units and lines of business or between business and technology.Managing Business Requirements activities by providing end-to-end analysis for initiatives with respect to business and functional requirements, data requirements, regulatory requirements, workflow context and design, as well as user interface designs within and across systems.Authoring thorough, detailed, high-quality documentation of all aspects of the Ratings systems and ancillary tools, including business requirements, use cases, Business System Concept documents, research templates, operating procedures and governance processes .Ability to map regulatory requirements to business processes.  Ensures compliance and verifies new regulations are adequately addressed through existing or new processes and enabled in the appropriate application.Supporting data migration efforts by analyzing business processes to understand current and future data needed to support those processes, working closely with Data Governance and Data Operations teams to address any gaps.Plan and lead meetings and working sessions effectively with both business and technology teams. Support change management and training initiatives, as needed.  Train users on existing or new applications, when required.  Scope/Supervision and Interaction : This position works as a liaison between business groups and software developers, and will interact with senior internal personnel    qualifications:  Qualifications    Undergraduate/first-level degree (e.g., Bachelors degree) in a related field required.3-5 years of experience in project management, process design, information technology, business operations or related field, preferably in the financial services industry, with a proven track record of interfacing with multiple levels of the organization.  Previous experience and record of effectively leading process driven projects in a large scale business and technology transformation or improvement efforts.System/business analysis experience required.Ability to coordinate and assist large teams in resolving complex analytical issues.Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines.Excellent oral and written communication skills, including very good presentation skills.Good interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong professional relationships at all levels, with both internal and external parties.   skills:   Key Tech and Non-Technical Skills:   Ability to work in multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural teams, proven teamwork with demonstrated experience in collaborating across organizational boundaries and locations.Strong meeting/workshop facilitation skills and documented experience.Strong leadership skills across both single discipline and multi-discipline teams.Experience in various aspects of systems development, including development, project management, business analysis and UI design.Experience with application integration and developing workflow and functional Use Cases. Knowledge of Agile development process and the use of a supporting requirement tool is preferred.Proven ability to articulate application requirements and functionality to IT peers.Demonstrated ability to manage different and often conflicting objectives/activities at one time.Experience in quickly and effectively adjusting priorities and goals in changing circumstances.Maturity in dealing with all levels of business. Strengthen relationships across business by engaging business stakeholders to establish credibility, solve problems, build consensus and achieve objectives.Must be an effective facilitator and comfortable with working through ambiguity to develop effective solutions.     Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: ER RN
description: \r\n                            Were searching for Emergency Room (ER) Travel Nurses to fill immediate openings at a hospital in Elizabeth, NJ. If this sounds great to you, and you have 2+ years of experience, keep reading and well make sure you get all the details.  What will I do? Emergency Room (ER) Travel Nurses act as the "eyes and ears" for Physicians in the ER by collecting primary and secondary assessment data in addition to providing direct patient care. This includes: triaging, diagnosing and prioritizing patients based on severity of need; stabilizing patients experiencing trauma; and ruling out acute medical emergencies, when appropriate, and discharging the patient safely. You will also be responsible for working with patients and families in crisis, and educating them regarding follow-up care.  What are the benefits? Weekly take-home pay between $20 and $60 per hour including per- diems-top-tier benefits that help you focus on taking care of your patients and know youre being taken care of, too.  What else do I need to know? A qualified Emergency Room (ER) Travel Nurse will have an Associates Degree or Bachelor of Science in Nursing and hold a current/active license as a registered nurse in the state of NJ, in addition to current certifications in BLS and other unit specific certifications. title: Maintenance Mechanic
description: \r\n                            The Maintenance Mechanic is a full-time position. Under the guidance of the Plant Engineer, the Industrial Maintenance Mechanic is tasked with keeping the plant up-time as high as possible. He/She is responsible for preventative maintenance, repairs, spares inventory, and equipment functionality and safety. The Industrial Maintenance Mechanic works with the operations staff, under the direction of the Plant Engineer, to identify areas that need attention and continually develop preventative maintenance schedules to ensure timely completion. Ability to work unsupervised, stay on task, and complete multiple projects on time is essential.Responsibilities:Minimize downtime due to equipment failure and equipment maintenance.Troubleshoot and repair equipment that has failed.Create, update and implement preventative maintenance cycles for all equipment in the plant.Identify areas for improvement with equipment application, functionality, layout or usage. Troubleshoot failure points and recommend changes.Communicates and schedules known downtime to limit impact to production.Identify and correct safety concerns dealing with processing equipment.Ensure the proper functioning of pumps, motors, mixers, piping, valvesWorking hours: 8:00 AM - 4:30 PMSkills:Must have knowledge of functionality and maintenance of pumps, compressors, burners, 480V motors, process instrumentation and control wiring.Knowledge of PLC controls, centrifuges, vacuum pumps, filter presses, gear boxes and control valves.Ability to effectively and efficiently communicate needs to management.Ability to read, understand, follow, and enforce company rules and regulations as well as OSHA standards and requirements.Must have great attention to detail.Needs to be able to work independently or with little supervision.Qualifications:Minimum 2 years experience working with mechanical maintenance.Randstad is a world leader in matching great people with great companies. description: \r\n                            job summary: Accounts Receivable Specialist - New Hyde Park, NY  This is 1 contract role expected to last 2 months. Accounts Receivable Specialist - Job Responsibilities:  Works over a broad network of internal departments and customers organizations to ensure billing, statements, disputes and returns are completed to the customers expectation.  Performs in-depth customer payment analysis to properly record actions required to resolve disputed items; responsible for the activities involving tracing sources of error, correcting billing documentation, and processing final billing.  Assists in training and mentoring new personnel and follow up to ensure new hires are successful. Reviews large and high profile accounts. Overall team-player who will be looked upon as the go-to system resource Identifies payment discrepancies and initiates dispute resolution process; performs follow up procedures as needed.  Job Requirements:   Normally requires more than three (3) years of Business to Business or Business to Govt collection and dispute resolution experience. title: Payroll Manager
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Are you looking for your next Payroll Management Position?  Do you have 5-10 years of Payroll Management experience as well as your CPP or APA certifications? Payroll Manager New York Position Summary Reporting to the Head of North America Payroll, the Manager, Payroll (US) is responsible for leading and managing a US payroll operations team dedicated to specific companies, which include union and non-union employees, directors fees, and retirees, and benefits.  The Manager will ensure compliance with Federal and State legislation as well as Fair Labor Standards Act that applies to payroll and ensuring compliance with company policies and SOC1 requirements. Partnering with the respective companies HR teams, the incumbent oversees the audit and processing of new hires, terminations, status changes, allocation changes, pay rate increases, retro and bonus pay, and manual checks, prepares import templates for salary increases and retro and bonus payments, oversees and approves payroll journal entries and general ledgers and oversees and approves payroll, benefits and union dues funding. The Manager, Payroll (US) is also responsible for working with the HRIS team for Workday HRIS payroll and benefits tables and codes administration and to create Workday HRIS environment change requests and validate test results when received before they are put into production. title: Accounting Manager- CPA
description: \r\n                            job summary:  Position ·  The position reports to the CPA 18 Controller ·  Exposure to complex accounting transactions, 10-K and 10-Q reviews, taxes, foreign exchange and the overall consolidation process ·  Join a motivated group of professionals that primarily come from a public accounting background    location: New York, New York  job type: Permanent  salary: $110,000 - 125,000  per year  work hours: 9 to 5  education: Bachelors degree  experience: 0 Years     responsibilities:  Job Responsibilities ·  Analyze and review complex transactions, including but not limited to acquisitions, dispositions, refinancings, build to suit transactions, lease restructurings etc. ·  Analyze both consolidated and unconsolidated joint venture investments ·  Prepare monthly, quarterly and annual consolidated financial statements and related supporting schedules. ·  Review detailed balance sheet analyses and income statement variance and fluctuation analyses in connection with closing packages prepared by staff. ·  Review and analyze foreign currency movements, as well as review and analyze complex foreign currency transactions. ·  Review intercompany and related-party transactions and perform supporting reconciliations. ·  Prepare statement of cash flows and review supporting workpapers. ·  Coordinate with and assist financial reporting team in reviewing 10K/10Q disclosures and reviewing supporting workpapers prepared by staff. ·  Assist in preparing or reviewing supporting schedules for auditors and responding to audit inquiries    qualifications:  REQUIREMENTS ·  5-7  years experience in Big 4 Accounting Firm and/or private industry; ·  BS/BA in Accounting; Masters and/or CPA a plus ·  Exposure to the accounting for various transactions, evolving accounting standards, financial statements and process implementations ·  Experience in analyzing real estate transactions ·  Experience in consolidation and equity method investment accounting ·  Knowledge of accounting principles in lease accounting ·  Excellent analytical, problem solving and organization skills ·  Strong communication skills, both written and verbal ·  Ability to work independently and manage a team ·  Attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment ·  Proficient computer skills - knowledge of JDE and/or Hyperion a plus    skills: CPA    Equal Opportunity Employer: Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Sexual Orientation, Gender Identity, National Origin, Age, Genetic Information, Disability, Protected Veteran Status, or any other legally protected group status.\n

title: Administrative Assistant Intermediate level
description: \r\n                            Description: Admin Assistant / Legal AdminPURPOSE The Administrative Assistant III performs a wide variety of tasks such as typing, formatting, and editing correspondence and reports; organizing and correcting computer-based records and files; organizing and preparing materials for use in presentations; scheduling meetings and events; assisting telephone callers and visitors; and providing related assistance to one or more officer or director. This is very highly skilled technical or administrative work in which incumbents are experienced in their assigned roles and working under direct supervision.*FUNCTION Creates routine correspondence, reports and forms in support of department. Types, formats, and edits non-routine correspondence, reports, forms and related documents using word processing software. Organizes files and computer databases and makes corrections to information in files. Prepares advanced charts, graphs, tables, and presentations using word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation software. Answers the telephone, screens and routes calls and takes messages for senior staff. Provides information as appropriate; greets and assists visitors. Receives, opens, and routes mail for officers. Prepares mail for pick-up. Obtains information and materials and prepares reports. Assures that documents and materials are copied, collated, and distributed as required. Orders, stocks, and distributes stationary, forms, office supplies, equipment, and furniture. Schedules and organizes meetings, luncheons, and events. Prepares meeting agendas, takes minutes, and documents decisions. Makes travel arrangements, obtains confirmations and tickets, and prepares travel expense reports.*OTHER RESP *EDU EXP High school diploma or equivalent. title: C# Developer with Some Siteminder
description: \r\n                            job summary: Who We Are + What We Do: The Product Platform Engineering - Core Domain team builds solutions to provide Cox Automotive brands common capabilities and shared data to revolutionize the way the world buys, sells and owns cars. On this team, you will have the opportunity to do your best work and lead the digital revolution of the auto industry. Our Engineering professionals are energetic influencers and collaboration is woven into the fabric of everything we do; from 24-hour Hackathons to deeply held Agile values, youll be immersed in an environment that nurtures individualism, creative problem-solving, and intellect. Job Overview: Our Software Engineers are energetic influencers who thrive on designing simple and scalable solutions to complex problems, and delivering leading edge software products for our customers. We are looking for exceptionally ambitious and communicative hands-on individuals who are comfortable collaborating within the Agile methodology as part of a cross-functional team, have experience working in fast-paced environments, and who have the passion and skills to take our product offerings to the next level. As a Software Engineer you will work in a collaborative team environment that encourages you to perform at your best, while contributing to the engineering efforts of one of our scrum teams. You will be challenged to engineer right-sized solutions for complex business problems. You will apply your knowledge of modern software design, best practices, design patterns, and frameworks, with an understanding of application performance and maintainability. You will aspire to use new technologies and challenge yourself to develop innovative solutions. You will work alongside developers and technical leads on a team where collaborative programming and mentoring is regularly practiced. description: \nAs a member of Windows Server Infrastructure Integration team youll be responsible for system design and application integration on various platforms that support the Merrill Lynch Global Wealth Management business. Must be able to multi-task & work independently. Must be client focused. title: Production Support (Equities)
description: \n***FULLTIME***Our client, a large financial bank in NYC, is looking for a Production Support Analyst with Equities trading experience.Job DescriptionJoin a regional based team responsible for ensuring the smooth running of production Equity trading regionally. This is a Electronic trading support role with hands on Equity Algorithmic trading exposure.Provide day-to-day application support to front-office trading systems, which includes monitoring all kinds of high-touch, low-touch and co-location flows, managing client and market connectivity, answering user queries, monitoring applications, release of changes to production environment and post-release checking. Located on the trading floor. Interact closely with regional and global business users (traders and operations staff) and other groups in Technology to ensure issues are addressed and communicated in a timely manner.Troubleshoot production issues to identify root causes and track issues to their completion.Work closely with developers and business analysts to plan system rollout and application updates, provide feedback on production system performance, and investigate production problems and identify solutions.Manage serious outages in production by interfacing between business, developers, infrastructure teams and management. Main tasks include: provide communication, take remedial actions to resolve outage, provide information to business to alleviate knock-on impact, work on post-mortem and follow-up actions for root cause identification, recurrence prevention, and any improvement in problem detection and resolution.Candidates should be prepared to work out of normal business hours on a rota basis such as on weekends, or early morning shifts according to business needs.Proactively identify and resolve potential production problems in all trading systems and escalate them to relevant parties if necessary. Suggest improvements to existing processes for support both locally and globallyProvide performance and capacity monitoring and planning to the platform to ensure the applications are running in healthy state and enough capacity to handle volatile market volumes Technical skillsStrong UNIX command line skills Need to understand grep, awk, sed etcComfortable with shell scriptingGood Perl scripting skills.Proven record of automation.Strong understanding of low latency trading systemsStrong understanding of redundant, high availability design concepts as pertaining to equity trading systems.Good understanding of Tibco/EMS and other transport systems Business exposure requiredStrong equity trade support experienceIntimate understandingofAlgo trading systems. description: \n Functional Title: Clinical Business Analyst (ClinDoc & Orders) Senior Epic Certified Analyst must have previous Epic implementation experience for a 6-month contract. Individuals must have a strong background analyzing requirements gathered from clinical end users and other clinical stakeholders, creating BRDs, paper mock ups, flowcharts, project schedules and other tasks such as leading validation sessions and build. The right candidate will need the personality to assume ownership of a project, create guidance where there isnt any and influence the direction if it is not correct. applications.Experience documenting system architecture design and clinical system workflow.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a title: Information Security Manager - 3rd Party IT Risk
description: \nFULLTIME***Individual Contributor role, no direct reports*** The Information Security Manager- 3rd Party IT Risk, will be part of the Third Party Risk team responsible for the continuous monitoring of the companys most critically sensitive third parties. title: Epic Ambulatory Analyst
description: \n Functional Title: Clinical Business Analyst (Ambulatory, MyChart & Kaleidoscope) Senior Epic Certified Analyst must have previous Epic implementation experience for a 6-month contract. Epic Certification must be current or within prior release version. Individuals must have a strong background analyzing requirements gathered from clinical end users and other clinical stakeholders, creating BRDs, paper mock ups, flowcharts, project schedules and other tasks such as leading validation sessions and build. The right candidate will need the personality to assume ownership of a project, create guidance where there isnt any and influence the direction if it is not correct. Strong written and spoken language skills are a must and a strong background in clinical healthcare technologies and processes is strongly preferredEngagement Location, Hours and Duration:The engagement will take place at our NYC location. Consultant during this engagement is expected to travel 10% within the 5 boroughs of NYC.2.Principal Duties and Responsibilities*Interview users, stakeholders, and sponsors to assess departmental needs to create Business,functional and technical requirements documents.*Develop documentation of test plans, technical documentation, release notes, end-user guides, training programs and/or other materials as necessary.*Analyze and document clients business requirements and processes; communicate requirements to technical personnel by constructing basic conceptual data and process models, including process flowcharts and technical specifications.*Decompose information gathered into details including sources of data, data types, users, user types,interface components, interface navigation needs, reporting needs, and administrative system needs.*Presenting concepts in a concise and focused manner, including narrative, process diagrams, role and accountability diagrams and business-focused story boards.*Research industry practices; collect and analyze data; draw appropriate conclusions and recommendations; present results in written reports or through oral presentations using visual aids.*Coordinate user groups and project teams, convening conference calls and meetings and maintaining minutes and follow-up logs.*Work collaboratively with Systems Analyst to develop designs, mockups and prototypes.*Communicate technical design issues to non-technical people.*Ability to work independently and as part of a fast moving team.*Ability to lead Business in programs with complex projects.*Work within timeline and resource constraints provided by the Project Manager.*Provide ongoing communication with users, managers, corporate directors and vendors to assure support and current initiatives.*Experience with HL7 communications is a plus.*Experienced working in a Project Management Office (PMO) with cross-functional teams is a plus.*Performs other duties as assigned/required.Request for Statement of Work3.Qualifications / Required Skill:Completed multiple go-lives, and at least one from (near) inception to completionExperience with an Epic implementation at a multi-hospital system, and/or a major academic medical center.A Baccalaureate Degree from an accredited college or university in computer science, Information systems, business administration or equivalent experience or education is required.At least 3 years of clinical healthcare systems experience.At least 3 years of experience on commercial core clinical applications.Experience documenting system architecture design and clinical system workflow.Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group, executives, managers, and subject matter experts.Must be well organized, detail oriented, highly analytical, possess strong problem solving skills and must have a desire to be accountable for project success.Detailed knowledge of general phases of SDLC, project management methodsAMBULATORY ANALYST SPECIFIC QUALIFICATIONS / EXPERIENCE:Ambulatory Certification requiredKaleidoscope Certification (preferred)Orders Transmittal Certification (preferred)MyChart and/or EpicCare Link Certification (preferred)   About TEKsystems:Join TEKsystems®, a leading IT staffing, IT talent management and IT services firm, and get your career on the fast track. title: Senior SCCM Desktop Engineer
description: \n                                                    Our client, an international law firm in midtown Manhattan, is looking to hire a senior Desktop Delivery Engineer to join their team on a full time basis. This person will be part of a small team responsible for managing the firms SCCM infrastructure for patch management and image creation/management and AppSense infrastructure for profile management. This person will be heavily involved in the firms Windows 10 migration in regards to customization and optimization. They will work closely with the team lead to support and manage the SCCM, AppSense, health monitoring, and Citrix VDI environments. They will deploy enterprise-level software into the environment (both local and virtualized desktop) through extensive analysis, design preparation, and testing. This person will create and distribute desktop images through SCCM 2016. This person will be a senior resource for SCCM and AppSense. Candidates must have at least 5 years of desktop engineering experience in corporate environments. Candidates must have strong SCCM patch management and image management/creation experience. Candidates must have experience with SCCM 2012 or 2016. Experience with AppSense for profile management or a similar profile management tool is a big plus. Candidates must have experience with creating and distributing images in a VDI environment. Candidates must have experience supporting Windows Active Directory/Group Policy environments. Candidates should have basic Powershell scripting experience. This position will sit in midtown Manhattan and is easily commutable by public transportation. The firm is offering a competitive base salary, bonus, and a comprehensive benefits package and retirement plan. description: \n                                                    Our client, an international law firm in downtown Manhattan, is looking to hire a Messaging and Remote Access Engineer on a full time basis. title: Cyber Business Analyst
description: \nSCOPE OF SERVICES: The Cyber Business Analyst will work closely with the program manager, Leadership and other IT project leads, and stakeholders assure that all Security Management requirements are identified and met, including verifying that reports and documentation are complete and properly handled across all areas of the City. description: \nWe are looking for a highly motivated, senior, full-stack .NET Developer to assist with design, development, and support on a browser-based, global financial compliance system. This system supports regulatory requirements for Short Selling and certain aspects of Credit Default Swaps across every jurisdiction where the bank does business. It provides reporting and monitoring of global end-of-day net short positions and other notification requirements as well as critical position information used in regulatory disclosure reporting for downstream systems.An ideal candidate should be self-starting, have a thorough understanding of the technologies outlined in the requirements below, and capable of addressing issues across architectural boundaries. However, primary focus of responsibilities will be in the user experience, which is based primarily in the following: C#, Linq2Db, ASP.NET MVC 5.x, jQuery, Bootstrap 3, Kendo UI, and LESS.Responsibilities:* Works closely with other NYC-based team members and business partners to design, develop, enhance, test, support, maintain, and debug software solutions that support business units or support functions.* A senior member of the technical team responsible for assisting senior business leaders and management.* Contributes to strategic technical direction and system architecture for individual initiatives.* Employs in-depth knowledge of technological alternatives and business process requirements to recommend innovations that enhance and/or provide a competitive advantage to the organization.* Provides total-effort estimation for deliverables for one or more programmers with minimal margin of error.* Coordinates collaboration with business solutions and other development teams as needed to deliver on time and within budget.* Provides feedback and technical guidance to project managers on issues of critical importance to achieving business objectives.Skills & Experience:* Required: 10+ years of overall hands-on software development experience.* Required: MUST demonstrate exceptionally clear communication skills* Required: 3+ years of experience as a team Required: 5+ years of experience C# expressions (LINQ & Lambda), thread & memory management, asynchronous development patterns, and data serialization/deserialization (XML & JSON)* Required: 5+ years of user interface design and development, including at least 3 years with responsive design and Bootstrap 3* Required: 5+ years of experience with client-side development technologies including JavaScript and jQuery with a complete understanding of AJAX* Required: 3+ years of experience and a complete understanding of HTTP & REST and ASP.NET MVC core concepts (including Routing, Bundling,
